analyzed: bdun pa ni yang dag pa'i lam du 'gro ba dam pa dang kun du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The seventh is the disciple's going on the right path, because he is in union with the holy.

original: brgyad pa ni dam pa dang kun du 'du ba byang chub sems dpa'i don ji lta ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni dam pa dang kun du 'du ba byang chub sems dpa'i don ji lta ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the disciple's right practice, because he is in union with the holy, and because he is a Bodhisattva who has the right aim.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i legs par bsdus pa sngar bstan pa bzhi ba phrag bzhi po dag kyang gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub pa'i go rims su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i legs par bsdus pa sngar bstan pa bzhi ba phrag bzhi po dag kyang gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub pa'i go rims su rig par bya ste /
translated: The four groups of four virtues of right practice, as previously taught, should be known in the order of their accomplishment.

original: bzhi pa dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par zhugs pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs stsog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par zhugs pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs stsog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first group of four is the accumulation of the merit and knowledge of the Bodhisattva who has entered correctly.

original: bzhi pa gnyis pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs stsog pa la brten nas sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa gnyis pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs stsog pa la brten nas sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth of the second is because of the purification of obscurations in dependence on the collection of merit and pristine wisdom.

original: bzhi pa gsum pa ni sgrib pa rnam par dag pa la brten nas dkar po'i chos kyi sgo thams cad kun du 'thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbzhi pa'i bzhi pa ni dkar po'i chos kyi sgo thams cad kun du thob pa la brten nas rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don la sbyor ba dang / bsod nams @203a * //
analyzed: bzhi pa gsum pa ni sgrib pa rnam par dag pa la brten nas dkar po'i chos kyi sgo thams cad kun du 'thob pa'i phyir ro // bzhi pa'i bzhi pa ni dkar po'i chos kyi sgo thams cad kun du thob pa la brten nas rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don la sbyor ba dang / bsod nams @203a * //
translated: The third of the fourth is because of the attainment of all the doors of virtuous dharmas in dependence on the purification of obscurations.

original: dpag tu med pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth of the fourth is because of the application to the aim of sentient beings in all aspects and the generation of immeasurable merit in dependence on the attainment of all the doors of virtuous dharmas.

original: bzhi pa phrag nyi shu po'i go rims ni bshad zin to /
analyzed: bzhi pa phrag nyi shu po'i go rims ni bshad zin to /
translated: The order of the twenty sets of four has been explained.

original: // / da 'di man chad ni de dag nyid kyi tshig gnyer bshad pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da 'di man chad ni de dag nyid kyi tshig gnyer bshad pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: From here on, the explanation of the individual words of those [sets of four] will be stated.

original: 'od srungs chos bzhi po 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'di ci'i phyir brtsams she na /
analyzed: 'od srungs chos bzhi po 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'di ci'i phyir brtsams she na /
translated: Why is it that [the Buddha] began this [section] with, KƒÅ≈õyapa, these four dharmas cause the wisdom of bodhisattvas to decline?

original: smras pa / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob bar bya ba'i thabs la rmongs pa rnams la bstan pa dang / bag med pa rnams yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / zhum pa rnams gzengs bstod pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob bar bya ba'i thabs la rmongs pa rnams la bstan pa dang / bag med pa rnams yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / zhum pa rnams gzengs bstod pa dang /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúFor those who have entered the Great Vehicle, but are confused about the means to attain unsurpassed enlightenment, it is taught in order to make them understand, to cause the heedless to take it up correctly, to encourage the fainthearted,

original: yang dag par zhugs pa dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and to delight those who have entered correctly.

original: 'od srungs zhes bka' stsal pa ni nyan pa rnams la 'dun par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs zhes bka' stsal pa ni nyan pa rnams la 'dun par sbyor ba'o //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is said in order to inspire those who listen.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni gang zag bsal ba'i phyir chos zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩchos kyi sgra ma smos na ci chos yin nam /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni gang zag bsal ba'i phyir chos zhes bya ba smos te / chos kyi sgra ma smos na ci chos yin nam /
translated: The word ‚ÄòDharma‚Äô is used to eliminate the person.

original: 'on te gang zag yin zhes the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gang zag yin zhes the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word ‚ÄòDharma‚Äô is not used, there would be doubt as to whether it is the Dharma or a person.

original: smras pa / rang gi sgra brjod pa'i phyir bzhi zhes grangs smos pa ni don med do //
analyzed: smras pa / rang gi sgra brjod pa'i phyir bzhi zhes grangs smos pa ni don med do //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúSince the word ‚Äòown‚Äô is used, it is meaningless to state the number ‚Äòfour.‚Äô

original: smras pa / bzhi zhes grangs smos pa ni rgya che bar dogs nas de nyan mi 'dod pa rnams spang ba dang / grangs smos pa dag kyang dran par bya ba dang / gzung sla ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / bzhi zhes grangs smos pa ni rgya che bar dogs nas de nyan mi 'dod pa rnams spang ba dang / grangs smos pa dag kyang dran par bya ba dang / gzung sla ba'i phyir te /
translated: He said: The mention of the number four is for the purpose of eliminating the fear of the vastness of the subject matter, for those who do not want to hear about it; for the purpose of remembering the number; and for the purpose of easy retention.

original: me tog brgyus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me tog brgyus pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a garland of flowers.

original: ci'i phyir bzhi nyid de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzhi nyid de /
translated: Why is it just four?

original: mi mang mi nyung zhe na /
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung zhe na /
translated: Why is the number not more or less?

original: la la na re ha cang skyon du 'gyur bas klan ka ra mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: la la na re ha cang skyon du 'gyur bas klan ka ra mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Some say: It is not subject to criticism, because it is not excessive.

original: gzhan dag ni shes rab kyi tshogs rnam pa gsum yongs su nyams pa bsdus pa'i phyir bzhi'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni shes rab kyi tshogs rnam pa gsum yongs su nyams pa bsdus pa'i phyir bzhi'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is four because it includes the three kinds of degeneration of the aggregate of wisdom.

original: mdor na shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mdor na shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, wisdom is threefold:

original: thos pa'i dang / bsam pa'i dang / bsgom pa'i'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i dang / bsam pa'i dang / bsgom pa'i'o //
translated: from listening, reflecting, and meditating.

original: de la tshig dang po gong ma gsum po dag gis ni shas cher thos pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su nyams par ston to //
analyzed: de la tshig dang po gong ma gsum po dag gis ni shas cher thos pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su nyams par ston to //
translated: Among them, the first three phrases show the degeneration of the aggregate of wisdom that is mostly from listening.

original: tshig bzhi pa thams ni shas cher bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs phyir zhing yongs su nyams par ston te de bas ni bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa thams ni shas cher bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs phyir zhing yongs su nyams par ston te de bas ni bzhi nyid do //
translated: The four-line verse is taught for the sake of the accumulation of wisdom through contemplation and meditation, and for the sake of the non-degeneration of the accumulations.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni chos nye ba 'di dag nyid kyi so sor rnam par dbye ba'i bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni chos nye ba 'di dag nyid kyi so sor rnam par dbye ba'i bshad pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase these refers to the explanation of the individual divisions of these very proximate dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i don brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: the meaning of bodhisattva should be expressed.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs mang yang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs mang yang /
translated: Although there are many synonyms for those who have entered the Great Vehicle,

original: byang chub sems dpa' smos pa ni rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' smos pa ni rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis rig par bya ste /
translated: the mention of bodhisattva should be understood by these three aspects:

original: mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / khong du chud ba'o //
analyzed: mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / khong du chud ba'o //
translated: aspiration, application, and realization.

original: mos @203b pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mos @203b pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is aspiration like?

original: shes bya zab mos rtogs pa la mos pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya zab mos rtogs pa la mos pa'o //
translated: It is aspiration for the realization of the profound knowable.

original: sbyor ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is application like?

original: bdag dang gzhan yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is application for the cause of perfect enlightenment for oneself and others.

original: khong du chud pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khong du chud pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the understanding?

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis byang chub khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis byang chub khong du chud pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding of enlightenment through the power of wisdom.

original: shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang / ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang / ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The words deterioration of wisdom refer to deterioration of what has been obtained and what has not been obtained.

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is deterioration of what has been obtained and what has not been obtained?

original: yongs su nyams pa gang gis yongs su nyams pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa gang gis yongs su nyams pa ste /
translated: It is deterioration through which one deteriorates.

original: zag pa med pa ni ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pas so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pas so //
translated: The uncontaminated is deterioration of what has not been obtained.

original: gzhan ni gnyi ga bye brag med pas so //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyi ga bye brag med pas so //
translated: The other is deterioration of both, without distinction.

original: shes rab las yongs su nyams pa'i tshig gis ni bye brag med pa'i phyir gal te zag pa med pa las gtogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab las yongs su nyams pa'i tshig gis ni bye brag med pa'i phyir gal te zag pa med pa las gtogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: If one were to say that the words deterioration of wisdom refer to deterioration of the uncontaminated, this would be incorrect,

original: bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been explained.

original: shes rab kyi tshogs yongs su nyams pa zhes brjod pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu gdags par byas nas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi tshogs yongs su nyams pa zhes brjod pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu gdags par byas nas brjod pa'o //
translated: The words deterioration of the accumulation of wisdom are used because the effect is figuratively designated by the cause.

original: shes rab las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it called ‚Äúdegeneration of wisdom‚Äù?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab ni /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab ni /
translated: Because contaminated wisdom

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi tshogs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi tshogs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: is the accumulation of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa ni thob pa dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams so //
analyzed: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa ni thob pa dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams so //
translated: Therefore, the contaminated degenerates through the degeneration of attainment and non-attainment.

original: zag pa med pa ni ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The uncontaminated degenerates only through the degeneration of non-attainment.

original: zag pa med pa la ni thob pa las yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la ni thob pa las yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: There is no degeneration of the uncontaminated through attainment.

original: smras pa / ji ltar na mi gus pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar na mi gus pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
translated: It was asked: How do phenomena such as disrespect cause degeneration of wisdom?

original: smras pa / khong khro bas na mi gus so //üîΩmi gus pas na mi nyan to //
analyzed: smras pa / khong khro bas na mi gus so // mi gus pas na mi nyan to //
translated: It was said: Through anger, one is disrespectful.üîΩThrough disrespect, one does not listen.

original: mi nyan pas na byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi nyan pas na byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Through not listening, one does not understand.

original: ma byang bas ni tshe 'di nyid la shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byang bas ni tshe 'di nyid la shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through not understanding, one degenerates from wisdom in this very life.

original: chos la ser sna byed cing /
analyzed: chos la ser sna byed cing /
translated: One is stingy with the Dharma.

original: slob dpon chos 'chad pas ni mi ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon chos 'chad pas ni mi ston to //
translated: The master does not teach the Dharma.

original: mi ston pas na tshe rabs gzhan na rkyen dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ston pas na tshe rabs gzhan na rkyen dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not teach, in other lives he will not have the conditions for it.

original: rkyen dang mi ldan pas shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan pas shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not have the conditions, he will decline in wisdom.

original: gang zag chos 'dod pa rnams la chos kyi bar chad byed par chos nyan pa la sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag chos 'dod pa rnams la chos kyi bar chad byed par chos nyan pa la sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who desire the Dharma, he creates an obstacle to the Dharma, obscuring the listener.

original: nyan pa la sgrib pas gti mug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan pa la sgrib pas gti mug par 'gyur te /
translated: Since he obscures the listener, he becomes deluded.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa skyed do //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa skyed do //
translated: He generates demerit.

original: de bas na tshe rabs gzhan na yang rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na tshe rabs gzhan na yang rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in other lives, he will be deluded.

original: rmongs pas na shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //üîΩbdag stong cing gzhan smod pa na phyin @204a * //üîΩci log tu mngon par zhen pas log par ston to //
analyzed: rmongs pas na shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro // bdag stong cing gzhan smod pa na phyin @204a * // ci log tu mngon par zhen pas log par ston to //
translated: Since he is deluded, he will decline in wisdom.üîΩWhen he disparages others, he teaches falsely, because he is attached to error.

original: phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen te log par ston pas tshe rabs gzhan na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen te log par ston pas tshe rabs gzhan na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he teaches falsely, attached to error, in other lives he will be mistaken.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pas shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pas shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this error, they will fall away from wisdom.

original: smras pa / gang gi dus na yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi dus na yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúWhen will they fall away?‚Äù

original: smras pa / dus gnyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / dus gnyis te /
translated: She said, ‚ÄúThere are two times:

original: tshe 'di dang / tshe rabs gzhan na'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang / tshe rabs gzhan na'o //
translated: in this life and in other lives.‚Äù

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe rabs gzhan 'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe rabs gzhan 'o //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIn what other lives?‚Äù

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ser sna la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang yod na ci'i phyir shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid bstan gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ser sna la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang yod na ci'i phyir shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid bstan gyi /
translated: She said, ‚ÄúWhen the qualities of stinginess and so on, which are the causes of falling away from generosity and so on, exist, why are only the causes of falling away from wisdom taught?

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur bam yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur bam yin /
translated: Are generosity and so on not causes of falling away?‚Äù

original: smras pa / gtso bo'i phyir te shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: smras pa / gtso bo'i phyir te shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid ni byang chub bo //
translated: She said, ‚ÄúBecause of their preeminence. The essence of wisdom is awakening.

original: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni shes rab la gnas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni shes rab la gnas so //
translated: The other perfections are based on wisdom.‚Äù

original: shes rab la log par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub dang byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos rnams la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la log par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub dang byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos rnams la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is wrongly engaged in wisdom is wrongly engaged in enlightenment and in the qualities that lead to enlightenment.

original: shes rab la yang dag par zhugs na byang chub dang byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la yang dag par zhugs na byang chub dang byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: But when he is rightly engaged in wisdom, he is rightly engaged in enlightenment and in the qualities that lead to enlightenment.

original: de bas na shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid bstan gyi /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid bstan gyi /
translated: Therefore, the causes of decline in wisdom are taught,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa las yongs su nyams par gyur ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa las yongs su nyams par gyur ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the causes of decline in generosity and so on.üîΩThese four phrases, ‚Äúlack of respect‚Äù and so on, indicate four qualities that lead to decline in wisdom: not listening,

original: mi gus pa la sogs pa shes rab yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu tshig bzhi po 'di dag gis mi nyan pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi yongs su ston te /
analyzed: mi gus pa la sogs pa shes rab yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu tshig bzhi po 'di dag gis mi nyan pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi yongs su ston te /
translated: not asking questions,üîΩnot being attentive, and lack of respect.

original: mi gus pas ni mi nyan par yongs su ston to //
analyzed: mi gus pas ni mi nyan par yongs su ston to //
translated: Lack of respect indicates not listening.

original: chos la ser sna byed cing slob dpon chos 'chab pas ni mi ston to //
analyzed: chos la ser sna byed cing slob dpon chos 'chab pas ni mi ston to //
translated: Not asking questions indicates not teaching.

original: chos kyi bar chad byed pas nyan pa la sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bar chad byed pas nyan pa la sgrib pa'o //
translated: It is an obstacle to listening because it creates obstacles to the Dharma.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas ston pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas ston pa'o //
translated: It is a teaching that is distorted by the pride of thinking that one has attained what has not been attained.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i mi nyan pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po 'di dag la brten nas tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan na ye shes dang mi mthun pa'i chos bzhi po gzhan dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i mi nyan pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po 'di dag la brten nas tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan na ye shes dang mi mthun pa'i chos bzhi po gzhan dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Based on these four dharmas of not listening, etc., which are the degeneration of the accumulation of wisdom, four other dharmas that are adverse to wisdom arise in this life and in other lives.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: byang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rkyen dang mi ldan pa dang / gti mug par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: byang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rkyen dang mi ldan pa dang / gti mug par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are: not becoming skilled, not having the conditions, and becoming deluded.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa skyed pa dang / phyin ci log go //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa skyed pa dang / phyin ci log go //

translated: were on fire,

original: bya ba thams cad btang ste /üîΩmgo 'am thod @206a * //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad btang ste / mgo 'am thod @206a * //
translated: he would give up all his dutiesüîΩand strive to extinguish the fire on his head or turban.

original: la me 'bar ba bsal ba'i phyir rab tu 'bad par rtsom pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: la me 'bar ba bsal ba'i phyir rab tu 'bad par rtsom pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva,

original: thos pa ni shes rab kyi rgyu yin pa dang / shes rab kyang thams cad mkhyen pa 'thob pa'i bar gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa ni shes rab kyi rgyu yin pa dang / shes rab kyang thams cad mkhyen pa 'thob pa'i bar gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because learning is the cause of wisdom and wisdom is the cause of attaining omniscience.

original: gus pa dang ldan na thos pa yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: gus pa dang ldan na thos pa yongs su tshol lo //
translated: He seeks learning with respect.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan par 'dod pas ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams 'dzin to //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan par 'dod pas ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams 'dzin to //
translated: He retains the teachings as he has heard them, desiring the benefit of self and other.

original: gang thos pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa snying por byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang thos pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa snying por byed pa yin no //
translated: He makes practice essential, practicing in accordance with the meaning of what he has heard.

original: sgrub pa snying por byed pas de'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab skye'o //üîΩsmra ba dang brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya ba la smra ba'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin /
analyzed: sgrub pa snying por byed pas de'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab skye'o // smra ba dang brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya ba la smra ba'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin /
translated: and the wisdom that follows from that reason is born.üîΩHe does not hold to the supremacy of speech and expression.

original: brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin pa ni smra ba dang brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin pa ni smra ba dang brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: He does not hold to the supremacy of speech and expression means that he does not hold to the supremacy of speech and expression.

original: thos pas chog par 'dzin pa ma yin /
analyzed: thos pas chog par 'dzin pa ma yin /
translated: He does not hold to the supremacy of hearing.

original: 'chad pas chog par 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chad pas chog par 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He does not hold to the supremacy of explaining.üîΩThis means that he does not hold to the supremacy of hearing and explaining.

original: yang na mi dgos pa dang don med pa'i tshig dam par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na mi dgos pa dang don med pa'i tshig dam par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, it means that he does not hold to the supremacy of speech that is unnecessary and meaningless.

original: 'di dag gi go rims ni chos la mi gus pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi go rims ni chos la mi gus pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub ste /
translated: The order of these is as follows: Because of disrespect for the Dharma, one does not practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos la ser sna byed pas gang zag chos 'dod pa rnams la chos kyi bar chad byed do //
analyzed: chos la ser sna byed pas gang zag chos 'dod pa rnams la chos kyi bar chad byed do //
translated: Because of stinginess with the Dharma, one creates obstacles to the Dharma for persons who desire the Dharma.

original: de shes rab kyi rgyu rnam pa gsum po de las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi rgyu rnam pa gsum po de las yongs su nyams te /
translated: He falls away from the three causes of wisdom.

original: shes rab 'chal bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin no //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin no //
translated: He is a fool, and has the pride of one who is learned.

original: dkar po'i phyogs ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The bright side is the opposite of that.

original: chos la gus pa dang bcas pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la 'jug go //
analyzed: chos la gus pa dang bcas pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la 'jug go //
translated: He has respect for the Dharma, and he practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pas chos la ser sna byed pa dang bral te /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pas chos la ser sna byed pa dang bral te /
translated: He practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, and he is free from stinginess about the Dharma.

original: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: He teaches extensively to others the Dharma that he has learned.

original: chos ston par 'dod pa'i phyir mang du thos pa yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: chos ston par 'dod pa'i phyir mang du thos pa yongs su tshol lo //
translated: He seeks much learning for the sake of teaching the Dharma.

original: mang du thos nas bdag dang gzhan dag la phan gdags pa'i rgyu sgrub pa snying por byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mang du thos nas bdag dang gzhan dag la phan gdags pa'i rgyu sgrub pa snying por byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Having become learned, he makes the cause of benefiting himself and others his essential practice.

original: smra ba dang brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba dang brjod pa'i tshig dam par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not hold on to the words of the scriptures as being the highest.

original: shes rab ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the root of the thought of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: The thought of awakening is the root of omniscience.

original: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed par bya ba'i don du byang chub kyi sems las nyams pa dang / mi nyams pa'i rgyu'i chos ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed par bya ba'i don du byang chub kyi sems las nyams pa dang / mi nyams pa'i rgyu'i chos ston pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to not forget the thought of awakening, the Buddha taught the causes of the loss and non-loss of the thought of awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems nyams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems nyams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, the thought of awakening of bodhisattvas who have four qualities degenerates.‚Äù

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir nyams pa'i rgyu bzhi nyid de mi mang mi nyung /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir nyams pa'i rgyu bzhi nyid de mi mang mi nyung /
translated: It was said, ‚ÄúWhy are there just four causes of degeneration? Why are there not more or less?‚Äù

original: smras pa / nyams @206b pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / nyams @206b pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir ro //
translated: It was said, ‚ÄúBecause there are four kinds of degeneration.‚Äù

original: de las mdor bsdu na nyams pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de las mdor bsdu na nyams pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, degeneration is of four kinds.

original: ma brjod pas nyams pa dang / byang chub kyi sems la skyon du lta ba'i phyir log par brjod pas nyams pa dang / yang dag par blangs pa'i brda'i sems nyams pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i sems nyams pa ste /
analyzed: ma brjod pas nyams pa dang / byang chub kyi sems la skyon du lta ba'i phyir log par brjod pas nyams pa dang / yang dag par blangs pa'i brda'i sems nyams pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i sems nyams pa ste /
translated: Degeneration through not expressing it, degeneration through wrongly expressing it because of viewing the thought of awakening as faulty, degeneration of the thought that is the symbol of the vow, and degeneration of the thought that is obtained naturally.

original: nyams pa'i chos rnam pa 'di bzhi'i rgyu nyams pa bzhi nyid de /
analyzed: nyams pa'i chos rnam pa 'di bzhi'i rgyu nyams pa bzhi nyid de /
translated: The four causes of these four types of degeneration are the four degenerations.

original: go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in the same order.

original: slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin gnas la slu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin gnas la slu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Deceiving masters, gurus, and donors means

original: bla ma rnams la bdag gi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi smra'i /
analyzed: bla ma rnams la bdag gi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi smra'i /
translated: that one does not speak the truth to gurus,

original: brdzun gyi tshig gis bslu ba'i phyir bla ma rnams la slu ba yin no //
analyzed: brdzun gyi tshig gis bslu ba'i phyir bla ma rnams la slu ba yin no //
translated: but deceives them with false words.

original: de la slob dpon ni gling ba dang nye bar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de la slob dpon ni gling ba dang nye bar ston pa yin te /
translated: Here, a master is one who teaches and instructs.

original: gang nyes pa 'di lta bu byung ngo zhes gleng zhing 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa zhes nyes pa las 'byin pa'i thabs ston la /
analyzed: gang nyes pa 'di lta bu byung ngo zhes gleng zhing 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa zhes nyes pa las 'byin pa'i thabs ston la /
translated: When a fault occurs, he says, ‚ÄúThis has happened,‚Äù and he teaches the method for removing the fault, saying, ‚ÄúThis is not to be done.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gyis shig ces ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyis shig ces ston pa'o //
translated: He teaches, ‚ÄúDo it this way.‚Äù

original: bla ma ni phan par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bla ma ni phan par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: A guru is one who wishes to benefit.

original: sbyin gnas ni grangs su ma gtogs kyang yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin gnas ni grangs su ma gtogs kyang yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: A donor is one who has qualities, even if he is not included in the number.

original: de dag gis snying brtse ba'i phyir gleng phan bdag gi 'das par gyur pa brdzun gyi tshig gis mgo rmongs par byed de /
analyzed: de dag gis snying brtse ba'i phyir gleng phan bdag gi 'das par gyur pa brdzun gyi tshig gis mgo rmongs par byed de /
translated: Because of their compassion, they would deceive me with false words about my past.

original: des las kyi sgrib pa chen po sogs so //
analyzed: des las kyi sgrib pa chen po sogs so //
translated: Because of that, I would accumulate a great obscuration of karma.

original: las kyi sgrib pa che ba'i phyir ma brjod pas byang chub kyi sems las nyams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa che ba'i phyir ma brjod pas byang chub kyi sems las nyams par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the great obscuration of karma, I would not speak of it. Thus, one should understand that I would fall from the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: mgo rmongs par byed ma nus su zin kyang /
analyzed: mgo rmongs par byed ma nus su zin kyang /
translated: Even if I were not able to deceive myself,

original: brdzun la goms pa'i nyes pa'i sgrib pas kyang ;
analyzed: brdzun la goms pa'i nyes pa'i sgrib pas kyang ;
translated: because of the obscuration of the fault of being habituated to lying,

original: byang chub kyi sems las nyams par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems las nyams par gyur pa ste /
translated: I would fall from the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: 'di ni rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu dang po'o //
translated: This is the first cause.üîΩThe second cause is stated:

original: gzhan 'gyod pa med pa la 'gyod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams 'gyod pa med pa'i gnas la phyin ci log skyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan 'gyod pa med pa la 'gyod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams 'gyod pa med pa'i gnas la phyin ci log skyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúCausing regret in those who have no regret‚Äù means that I would cause those who are living in a state of no regret to generate a wrong view.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yang dag pa'i bslab pa la nye bar gnas pa rnams bslab pa'i tshig rnams la mgo rmongs par byed pas /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yang dag pa'i bslab pa la nye bar gnas pa rnams bslab pa'i tshig rnams la mgo rmongs par byed pas /
translated: He causes confusion about the words of the training of those who are living in the right training, who are spiritual compatriots.

original: 'di ltar tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pa la zhugs pa'i phyir sgyu dang g-yos bslab pa'i tshig rnams la mgo rmongs par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pa la zhugs pa'i phyir sgyu dang g-yos bslab pa'i tshig rnams la mgo rmongs par byed de /
translated: Thus, because he has entered into a lack of higher intention toward spiritual compatriots, he causes confusion about the words of the training through deceit and fraud.

original: las kyi sgrib pa mi bzad pa sogs so //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa mi bzad pa sogs so //
translated: He creates an unbearable karmic obstruction.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi sems la skyon du lta ba'i phyir log par brjod pas de byang chub kyi sems las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi sems la skyon du lta ba'i phyir log par brjod pas de byang chub kyi sems las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because he speaks falsely, viewing the thought of awakening as a fault, he falls from the thought of awakening.

original: mgo rmongs par byed ma nus su zin kyang nyes pa'i sgrib pas de byang chub kyi sems las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mgo rmongs par byed ma nus su zin kyang nyes pa'i sgrib pas de byang chub kyi sems las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if he is unable to cause confusion, he falls from the thought of awakening because of the obstruction of faults.

original: 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second cause.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la bsngags pa ma yin pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / @207a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la bsngags pa ma yin pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / @207a * //
translated: They utter unpleasant, unappealing, and unlikable words about beings who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: brjod pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin zhes bya ba ni chos don du gnyer ba rnams gang las chos thos par 'gyur ba de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i phyir te /üîΩgang dag theg pa chen po la mos par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: brjod pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin zhes bya ba ni chos don du gnyer ba rnams gang las chos thos par 'gyur ba de las phyir phyogs par byed pa'i phyir te / gang dag theg pa chen po la mos par 'dod pa'am /
translated: This means that they turn away from the Dharma those who seek the Dharma, from those who could hear the Dharma from them.

original: sgrub par 'dod par gyur pa dag de las mos pa bzlog pa'i phyir theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la bsngags pa ma yin pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub par 'dod par gyur pa dag de las mos pa bzlog pa'i phyir theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la bsngags pa ma yin pa smra ba'o //
translated: Those who wish to aspire to the Great Vehicle, or who wish to practice it, they turn away from aspiring to it, and they speak unpleasantly to beings who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: dmigs ma phye ba dang / dmigs kyis phye ba dang rnam par phye nas nyes par brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs ma phye ba dang / dmigs kyis phye ba dang rnam par phye nas nyes par brjod do //
translated: They speak of faults without distinguishing, by distinguishing, and by distinguishing and then not distinguishing.

original: de la dmigs ma phye bar nyes pa yongs su brjod pa ni bsngags pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin pa ste ;
analyzed: de la dmigs ma phye bar nyes pa yongs su brjod pa ni bsngags pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin pa ste ;
translated: Among these, speaking of faults without distinguishing is they utter unpleasant, unappealing, and unlikable words.

original: dper na ngang tshul ngan pa can zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ngang tshul ngan pa can zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the expression, ‚Äúone who has a bad disposition.‚Äù

original: dmigs kyis phye nas nyes pa brjod pa ni mi snyan pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs kyis phye nas nyes pa brjod pa ni mi snyan pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin pa ste /
translated: The expression of a fault by way of specification is the utterance of a verse with an unpleasant sound.

original: dper na mi gtsang bar spyod ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang bar spyod ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the expression, ‚Äúone who engages in impure conduct.‚Äù

original: rnam par phye nas nyes pa brjod pa ni brjod pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin te /
analyzed: rnam par phye nas nyes pa brjod pa ni brjod pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin te /
translated: The expression of a fault by way of analysis is the utterance of a verse with an unpleasant sound.

original: rnam pa 'di dang 'dis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dang 'dis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, it is like the expression, ‚Äúin this way and by this aspect.‚Äù

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dmigs ma phye ba dang / dmigs kyis phye ba dang rnam par phye nas nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir theg pa chen po sgrub par 'dod pa rnams la mgo rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dmigs ma phye ba dang / dmigs kyis phye ba dang rnam par phye nas nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir theg pa chen po sgrub par 'dod pa rnams la mgo rmongs par byed do //
translated: In this way, those who wish to practice the Great Vehicle are confused about the bodhisattvas because of the expression of faults without specification, with specification, and by way of analysis.

original: de de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi gus pa skyes te /
analyzed: de de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi gus pa skyes te /
translated: In this way, disrespect for the bodhisattvas arises in him.

original: yon tan yang dag par bcabs pas las kyi sgrib pa mi bzad pa sogs so //
analyzed: yon tan yang dag par bcabs pas las kyi sgrib pa mi bzad pa sogs so //
translated: Because of concealing their good qualities, he accumulates the karma of the terrible obscuration of karma.

original: sgrib pa des ni de'i yang dag par blangs pa'i brda'i sems nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa des ni de'i yang dag par blangs pa'i brda'i sems nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that obscuration, the mind of the rite of his acceptance is impaired.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yang dag par bcabs par ma nus su zin kyang nyes pa'i sgrib pas de'i sems nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yang dag par bcabs par ma nus su zin kyang nyes pa'i sgrib pas de'i sems nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if he is unable to conceal the virtues of the bodhisattvas, his mind is impaired by the obscuration of faults.

original: 'di ni rgyu gsum ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu gsum ba'o ;
translated: This is the third cause.

original: / sgyu dang / g-yos gzhan la nye bar spyod kyi /
analyzed: / sgyu dang / g-yos gzhan la nye bar spyod kyi /
translated: He practices with deceit and pretense toward others, not with a higher intention.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba rnams kyi gsang ba'i gnas rnam par 'byed pas mgo rmongs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba rnams kyi gsang ba'i gnas rnam par 'byed pas mgo rmongs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is confused about the secret points of the Dharma teachers.

original: de la sgyu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sgyu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therein, deceit is

original: bcos pas nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bcos pas nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: misconduct through fabrication.

original: de la g-yo zhes bya ba ni sems gya gyu ba'o //
analyzed: de la g-yo zhes bya ba ni sems gya gyu ba'o //
translated: Therein, pretense is a crooked mind.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin zhas bya ba ni rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rjes su zhugs pas chos smra ba'i gang zag rnams kyi gsang ba'i gnas rnam par 'byed pas sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin zhas bya ba ni rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rjes su zhugs pas chos smra ba'i gang zag rnams kyi gsang ba'i gnas rnam par 'byed pas sbyor ba ste /
translated: Not with a higher intention means that he is engaged in revealing the secret points of the persons who are Dharma teachers through not following their nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba rnams las gsang ba'i gnas dag thos nas theg pa chen po sgrub par 'dod pa rnams mos pa bzlog par @207b bya'o zhes de ltar sbyor bas las kyi sgrib pa chen po bsags te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba rnams las gsang ba'i gnas dag thos nas theg pa chen po sgrub par 'dod pa rnams mos pa bzlog par @207b bya'o zhes de ltar sbyor bas las kyi sgrib pa chen po bsags te /
translated: The bodhisattva who, having heard the secret topics from Dharma teachers, would turn away those who wish to practice the Great Vehicle, would accumulate a great action-obscuration.

original: las kyi sgrib pa des chos nyid kyis 'thob pa'i sems las ring du gyur pa'i tshul gyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa des chos nyid kyis 'thob pa'i sems las ring du gyur pa'i tshul gyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that action-obscuration, his mind would be impaired, in the sense that it would be far from the mind that is attained naturally.

original: mos pa bzlog ma nus su zin kyang de'i nyes pa'i sgrib pa de lta bus kyang sems nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos pa bzlog ma nus su zin kyang de'i nyes pa'i sgrib pa de lta bus kyang sems nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he is unable to turn away those who are devoted, his mind would be impaired by that kind of obscuration of the fault of turning them away.

original: mdor bsdu na gang las nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na gang las nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In brief, from what is it impaired?

original: sems las so //
analyzed: sems las so //
translated: From the mind.

translated: The higher intention is

original: byang chub sems dpa' la khong khro bas byang chub kyi sems las byung ba'i gzhan la phan par bya ba las byung ba med pas sgyu dang g-yos gzhan la nye bar spyod pa'i lhag pa'i @208a * //üîΩbsam pa ma yin no //

translated: The order of the causes of non-regression is as follows: The cause of not losing the thought of awakening is the practice of truthful speech. translated: He generates the idea that all bodhisattvas are teachers, because he sees that the marvelous and immeasurable Dharma that comes from the thought of awakening and that comes from the thought to benefit others arises in his own mindstream, and because the thought of awakening is the cause of omniscience.

translated: It is to see or hear the Thus-Gone One‚Äôs utterly marvelous miracles, to hear the Dharma that is related to unsurpassed and perfect awakening, and to have compassion for sentient beings.üîΩ

analyzed: gzhan gyi stobs dang sbyor ba'i stobs kyis sems de skye ba ni mi brtan par skye bar rig par bya'o //

original: byang chub kyi sems ma nyams pa'i byang chub kyi sems de nyid la gnas par byas nas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yongs su zin pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la sbyor @209a * //

translated: The Lord has said, ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, when bodhisattvas have four qualities, wholesome actions that have been done and accumulated are completely exhausted.‚Äù

analyzed: smras pa / dge ba'i chos yongs su zad par 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBecause of four kinds of complete exhaustion of wholesome actions.

translated: Pride, conceit, hypocrisy, anger, and malice should be understood as they apply to spiritual teachers, disciples, those who are neither, those who are both, and those who are harmful, respectively.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs la yo ba'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs la yo ba'i rgyu ni /
translated: The cause of wavering in the accumulation of merit is

original: bden pa'i bsam pas longs spyod la mi lta bar yongs su ston to //üîΩsrog gi bar chad du 'gyur yang zhes bya ba ni srog la mi lta ba'o//

original: khrob dang / gshe ba dang / smod pa dang / spyo ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / gsod pa dang / bcing ba byas pa thams cad la bdag gis nyes par sems zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di rnams la bye brag ci yod ce na /

translated: He has said this extensively.

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na zhe na /
translated: Why are there just four?

original: dmu rgod rnam pa bzhi'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmu rgod rnam pa bzhi'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are four causes of crookedness.

original: dmu rgod rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmu rgod rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of crookedness?

original: gnas la dmu rgod pa dang / 'jug pa la dmu rgod pa dang / yongs su spyod pa la dmu rgod pa dang / 'grogs pa la dmu rgod pa'o //üîΩde la dmu rgod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas la dmu rgod pa dang / 'jug pa la dmu rgod pa dang / yongs su spyod pa la dmu rgod pa dang / 'grogs pa la dmu rgod pa'o // de la dmu rgod ces bya ba ni /
translated: They are: wildness in regard to the object, wildness in regard to the means of entry, wildness in regard to complete enjoyment, and wildness in regard to companionship.

original: gdul dka' ba ste rta dmu rgod bzhin no //
analyzed: gdul dka' ba ste rta dmu rgod bzhin no //
translated: Wildness is difficult to tame.

original: dmu rgod du byed pa'i chos bzhi po 'di dag byang chub sems dpas bsgoms na sgrib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dmu rgod du byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmu rgod du byed pa'i chos bzhi po 'di dag byang chub sems dpas bsgoms na sgrib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dmu rgod du byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These four dharmas of wildness are called wildness because they are obscurations when a bodhisattva cultivates them.

original: de la thos pas g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa ni gnas la dmu rgod pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la thos pas g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa ni gnas la dmu rgod pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Wildness in regard to the object is the cause of wildness in regard to the object.

original: dper na rta dmu rgod sems ma zhi ba rang gi gnas su bzhag na 'dug tu mi btub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rta dmu rgod sems ma zhi ba rang gi gnas su bzhag na 'dug tu mi btub pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a wild horse, with an untamed mind, cannot be made to stay in its place.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dmu rgod kyang thos pa dam par 'dzin pas thos par g-yengs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dmu rgod kyang thos pa dam par 'dzin pas thos par g-yengs te /
translated: In the same way, a wild bodhisattva, because of holding to the highest of the scriptures, is distracted by the scriptures.

original: sems ma zhi bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la bzhag na 'dug tu mi btub po //
analyzed: sems ma zhi bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la bzhag na 'dug tu mi btub po //
translated: Because their minds are not calm, they cannot be settled by spiritual masters in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.

original: rjes su bstan pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa ni 'jug pa la dmu rgod pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa ni 'jug pa la dmu rgod pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of being wild in application is to be distracted in the teaching.üîΩFor example, a wild horse, when put on a good path, becomes wild and goes off the path.

original: dper na rta dmu rgod lam bde bar bcug na dmu rgod du gyur pas lam mi bde bar 'jug pa de bzhin du byang @212b chub sems dpa' dmu rgod kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i rjes su bslabs shing
analyzed: dper na rta dmu rgod lam bde bar bcug na dmu rgod du gyur pas lam mi bde bar 'jug pa de bzhin du byang @212b chub sems dpa' dmu rgod kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i rjes su bslabs shing
translated: In the same way, a wild bodhisattva, when taught by spiritual masters the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching,

original: bstan na phyin ci log tu rtogs pas gdams ngag log par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan na phyin ci log tu rtogs pas gdams ngag log par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: misunderstands the instruction and holds it wrongly.

original: dang bas byin pa log par ltung bar byed pa ni yongs su spyod pa la dmu rgod pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: dang bas byin pa log par ltung bar byed pa ni yongs su spyod pa la dmu rgod pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of being wild in enjoyment is to cause the gift to fall wrongly.

original: dper na rta dmu rgod ni rta cang shes kyi nang du bcug na rta cang shes rnams dang yongs su spyod pa mi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na rta dmu rgod ni rta cang shes kyi nang du bcug na rta cang shes rnams dang yongs su spyod pa mi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: For example, a wild horse is not at all the same as a thoroughbred when it is put among thoroughbreds.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dmu rgod kyang byang chub sems dpa' cang shes kyi nang du son na tshul khrims la skyon yod pas dad pas byin pa za ba la 'gyod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dmu rgod kyang byang chub sems dpa' cang shes kyi nang du son na tshul khrims la skyon yod pas dad pas byin pa za ba la 'gyod de /
translated: In the same way, a wild bodhisattva is not the same as a thoroughbred bodhisattva when it comes to eating the gifts of the faithful, because of the defect in his morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' cang shes dang skal ba mi mnyam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' cang shes dang skal ba mi mnyam par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as not having the same share as the thoroughbred bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams la mi gus pa ni grogs la dmu rgod pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams la mi gus pa ni grogs la dmu rgod pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste /
translated: The undisciplined, wild bodhisattva is a cause of suffering for his companions,

original: dper na rta dmu rgod ni dmu rgod du gyur bas rta cang shes pa rnams dang 'grogs pa na sdug bsngal bar gnas so //
analyzed: dper na rta dmu rgod ni dmu rgod du gyur bas rta cang shes pa rnams dang 'grogs pa na sdug bsngal bar gnas so //
translated: just as a wild horse is a cause of suffering for the thoroughbreds when it is put among them.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dmu rgod rang gi lta ba bsnyems pa la gnas pa yang byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams dang 'grogs na sdug bsngal bar gnas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dmu rgod rang gi lta ba bsnyems pa la gnas pa yang byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams dang 'grogs na sdug bsngal bar gnas la /
translated: In the same way, when a wild bodhisattva who is conceited about his own view lives with disciplined, well-bred bodhisattvas, he lives unhappily.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams kyang dmu rgod kyis sdug bsngal bar gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams kyang dmu rgod kyis sdug bsngal bar gnas so //
translated: And the disciplined, well-bred bodhisattvas live unhappily when they are with the wild ones.

original: de la dul ba ni dbang po sdom pa bye brag tu 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dul ba ni dbang po sdom pa bye brag tu 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúdisciplined‚Äù means that the faculties are restrained, and ‚Äúwell-bred‚Äù means that they are distinguished.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs su rig par bya ste /
translated: The opposite of these should be understood as the dark side.

original: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' cang shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' cang shes pa'o //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, these four are the well-bred bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are the four?

original: legs par thos pa nyan te de la nan tan du byed cing don gyi phyir 'brang gi /
analyzed: legs par thos pa nyan te de la nan tan du byed cing don gyi phyir 'brang gi /
translated: They listen well to what they hear, and they practice it. They follow the meaning,

original: yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni skyon gdags pa dang / bag rkyong ste /
analyzed: yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni skyon gdags pa dang / bag rkyong ste /
translated: not the letter.

original: de skad brgal ba legs par lta bas chos nyan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de skad brgal ba legs par lta bas chos nyan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One who argues in this way is not a proper listener to the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen chos 'dzin pa la mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen chos 'dzin pa la mi slu ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices in this way is not deceptive toward the spiritual teacher who upholds the Dharma.

original: rjes su bstan pa la mthun par 'dzin cing bka' blo bde ba la legs par byed pa'i las byed cing /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa la mthun par 'dzin cing bka' blo bde ba la legs par byed pa'i las byed cing /
translated: He is one who accepts the instructions, is easy to speak to, and does what is to be done.

original: bla ma la nyan par gyur pa yin zhes bya ba tshig de dag gi don ci zhe na /
analyzed: bla ma la nyan par gyur pa yin zhes bya ba tshig de dag gi don ci zhe na /
translated: He is one who listens to the guru. What is the meaning of these words?

original: de la rjes su bstan ba la mthun par 'dzin ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la rjes su bstan ba la mthun par 'dzin ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, he who accepts the instructions means he who follows the teaching.

original: bka' blo bde zhes bya ba ni tshig bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bka' blo bde zhes bya ba ni tshig bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is easy to speak to because he is patient with words.

original: legs par byed pa'i las byed ces bya ba ni dus thams cad du nyes pa med pa'i @213a * //
analyzed: legs par byed pa'i las byed ces bya ba ni dus thams cad du nyes pa med pa'i @213a * //
translated: He does what is to be done because he is never at fault.

original: phyir ro // bla ma la nyan par gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag la gus pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // bla ma la nyan par gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag la gus pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is one who listens to the guru because he is full of respect for the advice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dgon pa la mi slu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dgon pa la mi slu'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices in this way is not deceived by spiritual friends who are in the forest.

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin ma nyams te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin ma nyams te /
translated: He is not lax in morality and meditative concentration.üîΩHe eats all foods as a noble one without pride does.

original: cang shes pas zas kun za zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la shin tu gus pas dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod par bstan to //
analyzed: cang shes pas zas kun za zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la shin tu gus pas dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he uses what is given in faith because of his great respect for the training.üîΩHe is not lax in morality and meditative concentration.

original: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin ma nyams zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshul khrims nyid ting nge 'dzin gyi sgrar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin ma nyams zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshul khrims nyid ting nge 'dzin gyi sgrar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, morality itself should be understood as meditative concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsod nams bya ba brtson pa la mi slu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsod nams bya ba brtson pa la mi slu'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices in this way is not deceived by spiritual friends who are diligent in the practice of merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams mthong na gus pa dang bcas /üîΩzhes dang bcas shing de la gzhol /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa rnams mthong na gus pa dang bcas / zhes dang bcas shing de la gzhol /
translated: When he sees disciplined, noble bodhisattvas, he is full of respect.üîΩHe is full of faith,üîΩhe is intent on that,

original: de la 'bab /
analyzed: de la 'bab /
translated: he is devoted to that,üîΩand he hopes for those qualities.

original: de la bab nas de de'i yon tan la re ba yin zhes bya ba tshig de dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la bab nas de de'i yon tan la re ba yin zhes bya ba tshig de dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these terms?

original: de la dul ba dang cang shes kyi don sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dul ba dang cang shes kyi don sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äútamed‚Äù and ‚Äúwell-trained‚Äù has been explained above.

original: gus pa dang bcas pa ni gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la gzhol ba ni lta 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa ni gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro // de la gzhol ba ni lta 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú With respect‚Äù means with reverence.üîΩ‚Äú Inclined‚Äù means with a desire to see.

original: de la 'bab pa ni bsnyen bkur byed 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'bab pa ni bsnyen bkur byed 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Attentive‚Äù means with a desire to serve.

original: de la bab pa ni nyan 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bab pa ni nyan 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Attenuated‚Äù means with a desire to hear.

original: de'i yon tan la re ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yon tan la re ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Hopeful for his good qualities‚Äù means with a desire to practice the Dharma in accordance with them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'khor dang 'dug pa la mi slu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'khor dang 'dug pa la mi slu'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices in this way does not deceive the spiritual friend, whether he is present or absent.

original: mdor bsdu na dmu rgod gang yin pa dang / ji lta ba dang / gang gi tshe dang ji snyed cig gis shes te yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na dmu rgod gang yin pa dang / ji lta ba dang / gang gi tshe dang ji snyed cig gis shes te yongs su bstan te /
translated: In brief, he knows the spiritual friend by his wildness, by his manner, by the time, and by the extent.

original: de la dmu rgod ni gdul dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dmu rgod ni gdul dka' ba'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúwild‚Äù means difficult to tame.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is he wild?

original: thos pa dam par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: thos pa dam par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyis so //
translated: By the causes of holding the bad as supreme, etc.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When is he wild?

original: 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan na ste /
analyzed: 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan na ste /
translated: in this life and in other lives,

original: goms par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of practice.

original: ji snyed cig gis she na /
analyzed: ji snyed cig gis she na /
translated: By how many?

original: thos pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: thos pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa la sogs pas so //
translated: By those beginning with the Dharma of distraction in listening.

original: dkar po'i phyogs ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //üîΩde dag gi go rims ni thos pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub ste /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o // de dag gi go rims ni thos pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub ste /
translated: The bright side should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: de bstan pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bstan pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su gnas pa yin no //
translated: The order of these is as follows: One who is distracted in listening does not practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, because he is distracted in teaching.

original: bstan pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su bstan pa ni dad pas byin pas log par ltung bar byed do //
analyzed: bstan pa la g-yeng ba'i chos su bstan pa ni dad pas byin pas log par ltung bar byed do //
translated: One who is distracted in teaching falls into wrong views because of the gifts of faith.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa can ni sgyu can te /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa can ni sgyu can te /
translated: Thus, the defiled person is deceitful.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa thob pa rnams la mi gus pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dul ba cang shes pa thob pa rnams la mi gus pa yin no //
translated: He is disrespectful to the disciplined, well-behaved bodhisattvas who have attained self-control.

original: de las bzlog pa ni @213b dkar po'i phyogs kyi go rims su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni @213b dkar po'i phyogs kyi go rims su rig par bya'o //
translated: The order of the bright side should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: dmu rgod du byed pa'i chos rnams dang bral te /
analyzed: dmu rgod du byed pa'i chos rnams dang bral te /
translated: He is free from the dharmas that cause wildness.

original: dmu rgod du byed pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams yang dag par 'dzin du bcug nas dmu rgod du byed pa ma yin pa'i chos la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi 'khrul ba'i chos yongs su spang ba dang / ma 'khrul ba'i chos yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i don du 'khrul ba dang /
analyzed: dmu rgod du byed pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams yang dag par 'dzin du bcug nas dmu rgod du byed pa ma yin pa'i chos la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi 'khrul ba'i chos yongs su spang ba dang / ma 'khrul ba'i chos yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i don du 'khrul ba dang /
translated: He causes them to take up the Dharma that is not wild and to abide in the Dharma that is not wild, in order to abandon the Dharma of confusion and to take up the Dharma of non-confusion.

original: ma 'khrul ba'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He teaches the Dharma of confusion and non-confusion in order to cause them to take up the Dharma of non-confusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has declared in detail, ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, these four are the confusions of the bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na smras pa /
translated: It is asked, Why are only four mentioned?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa ni 'khrul pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa ni 'khrul pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The confusion of the bodhisattva should be understood in terms of four kinds of confusion:

original: ma byas pa'i 'khrul pa dang / ha cang byas pa'i 'khrul pa dang / ngan par byas pa'i 'khrul pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i 'khrul pa dang / ha cang byas pa'i 'khrul pa dang / ngan par byas pa'i 'khrul pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i 'khrul pa'o //
translated: confusion of non-performance, confusion of over-performance, confusion of bad performance, and confusion of faulty performance.

original: de la ma byas pa'i 'khrul pa ni sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa rnams la yid rton pa ste /
analyzed: de la ma byas pa'i 'khrul pa ni sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa rnams la yid rton pa ste /
translated: The error of non-performance is to trust those who have not yet matured in virtue.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya bar brtsams la yongs su smin pa'i mthar ma phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya bar brtsams la yongs su smin pa'i mthar ma phyin pa ste /
translated: One has begun to mature sentient beings, but has not yet completed the maturation.

original: dad pa ma zhen pa'i sems can rnams la bar skabs su bshad pa'i rgyun gcong ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ma zhen pa'i sems can rnams la bar skabs su bshad pa'i rgyun gcong ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa'o //
translated: To interrupt the teaching in the middle for sentient beings who have faith but are not yet devoted is an error of the bodhisattva.

original: ha cang byas pa'i 'khrul pa ni sems can snod du gyur ba rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po bstan pa ste /üîΩsems can theg pa chung ngu ba /
analyzed: ha cang byas pa'i 'khrul pa ni sems can snod du gyur ba rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po bstan pa ste / sems can theg pa chung ngu ba /
translated: The error of excess is to teach the extensive Dharma of the Buddha to sentient beings who are not yet vessels.

original: theg pa chen po 'dod pa rnams la mi 'tshal ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'dod pa rnams la mi 'tshal ba bshad pa'o //
translated: It is to teach the Lesser Vehicle to sentient beings who are not interested in the Great Vehicle.

original: ngan par byas pa'i 'khrul ba ni rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa chung du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ngan par byas pa'i 'khrul ba ni rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa chung du bshad pa ste /
translated: The error of misbehavior is to teach the Lesser Vehicle to sentient beings who are interested in the Great Vehicle.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ston pa'i phyir rab tu 'byung ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'dzud pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba ni bstan pa las rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i gnyen por rab tu 'byung ba yang dag par 'dzin
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ston pa'i phyir rab tu 'byung ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'dzud pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba ni bstan pa las rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i gnyen por rab tu 'byung ba yang dag par 'dzin
translated: The spiritual teacher who is a bodhisattva who causes one to take up the life of a renunciate is the antidote to the degeneration of the teaching.

original: du 'dzud pas log pa'i bstan pa las ring du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: du 'dzud pas log pa'i bstan pa las ring du gyur pa yin te /
translated: He is the one who causes one to take up the life of a renunciate, because he is far removed from false teachings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis brtan pas gzhan gyi don bya bar nus pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis brtan pas gzhan gyi don bya bar nus pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ston pa'i phyir /
translated: and by the stability of all his roots of virtue, he is not deprived of the ability to work for the benefit of others.üîΩThe Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are the spiritual benefactors of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i gshes gnyen zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos las rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i gnyen por sangs rgyas las gdams ngag don yod pa'i bye brag thob par mthong bas zang zing la gdu ba ma
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i gshes gnyen zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos las rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i gnyen por sangs rgyas las gdams ngag don yod pa'i bye brag thob par mthong bas zang zing la gdu ba ma
translated: This shows that he does not hanker after material things, because he sees that the Buddhas are the unfailing source of instruction.

original: yin te / zang zing la gdu ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur na sangs rgyas kyis chos bstan pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin te / zang zing la gdu ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur na sangs rgyas kyis chos bstan pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For, if he hankered after material things, he would be deprived of the Buddhadharmas, but he is not deprived of the many roots of virtue because of the Buddhas' teaching of the Dharma.

original: dam pa ma yin pa dang 'du ba las bzlog ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa dang 'du ba las bzlog ste /
translated: He turns away from association with the ignoble.

original: dam pa dang 'du ba na byang chub sems dpa' don ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin du gzhug par bzhed nas sangs rgyas kyis don ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam pa dang 'du ba na byang chub sems dpa' don ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin du gzhug par bzhed nas sangs rgyas kyis don ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: When the Subduer was staying in the village of the Mallas, in order to make the Bodhisattva understand the meaning as it is, the Buddha taught the characteristics of the Bodhisattva as they are.

original: @215b 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: @215b 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: KaSyapa, these four are the Bodhisattva's reflections.

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na /
translated: It was said: Why are there just four?

original: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: It was said: The Bodhisattva's four reflections are to be known as the four reflections of the Bodhisattva, in terms of the four kinds of reflections of the Bodhisattva.

original: mang du thos pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dgon pa la gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / bsod nams bya ba la sbyor ba'i gzugs brnyan dang / tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: mang du thos pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dgon pa la gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / bsod nams bya ba la sbyor ba'i gzugs brnyan dang / tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: The reflection of the one who has heard much, the reflection of the one who lives in the forest, the reflection of the one who is engaged in the performance of merit, and the reflection of the one who gathers the accumulations.

original: 'thob pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa ma yin kyi /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa ma yin kyi /
translated: He is not one who desires gain and honor.

original: chos 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang bar chad byed par 'dod pa chos 'dzin kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: chos 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang bar chad byed par 'dod pa chos 'dzin kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: Not desiring the Dharma means that, even though a bodhisattva who is an obstacle to the Dharma holds the Dharma, it is not in accordance with the meaning.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: It is not in accordance with the meaning.

analyzed: brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'dod kyi /
translated: Desiring the sound of expression, verses,

analyzed: yon tan 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sgra 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dgon pa par gyur kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: It is not in accordance with the meaning.

original: bdag bde bar 'dod kyi sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni zang zing gi 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams bya ba la sbyor yang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag bde bar 'dod kyi sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni zang zing gi 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams bya ba la sbyor yang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: Desiring one's own happiness, not desiring to remove the suffering of sentient beings means that, even though a bodhisattva connects with the meritorious actions of a bodhisattva with a mind related to the result of material things, it is not in accordance with the meaning.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
translated: It is not in accordance with the meaning.

original: 'khor gyi tshogs 'dod kyi bden pa 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor gyi tshogs 'dod kyi bden pa 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line he does not desire a retinue or the pleasures of lifeüîΩmeans that even if a bodhisattva lives in a retinue with a mind free from
