analyzed: gang g-yog dang yongs su spyod pa dang / brjod pa dang 'bral ba'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang 'dug kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: the desire for attendants, for wealth, or for conversation, he does notüîΩhave the true goal.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
translated: He does not have the true goal.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni chos 'dzin pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sgrub pa ni chos 'dzin pa 'am /
translated: A bodhisattva who practices in this way, whether he is in a retinue or

analyzed: dgon pa 'am / bsod nams bya ba la sbyor ba 'am /
translated: in solitude,

analyzed: 'khor dang 'dug kyang rung ste /
translated: whether he is engaged in the practice of merit or in the retention orüîΩrecitation of the Dharma,üîΩwhether he is in a retinue or in solitude,

analyzed: bdag ma rung bar byed do //
translated: will not be able to help himself.

analyzed: de'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan rig par bya ste /

translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, these are the bodhisattva's true virtues.

analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na zhes rgya cher gsungs pa'o // de la stong pa nyid la /
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: mos pas 'thob pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, by his aspiration to emptiness, he does not obtain honor and gain.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pas chos don du gnyer te /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pas chos don du gnyer te /
translated: They seek the Dharma because they have confidence in the evolution of karma.

original: chos kyi rgyu bsod nams mang du sogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag med pa la bzod pas /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyu bsod nams mang du sogs pa'i phyir ro // bdag med pa la bzod pas /
translated: They seek merit as the cause of the Dharma.

original: brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: They seek the expression of the Dharma, verses, and so on, because they have patience with the teaching of selflessness.

original: snying rje bas byang chub @216a * //
analyzed: snying rje bas byang chub @216a * //
translated: They seek enlightenment because of their compassion.

original: sems dpa' yon tan 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' yon tan 'dod pa yin no //

original: bsam pas mya ngan las 'das par song bas bdag bde bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pas mya ngan las 'das par song bas bdag bde bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not seek the happiness of self because they are intent on nirvana.

original: sbyor ba 'khor bar song bas sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'khor bar song bas sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not seek to eliminate the suffering of beings because they are intent on samsara.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la lta ba'i sbyin pas 'khor gyi tshogs 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la lta ba'i sbyin pas 'khor gyi tshogs 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: They seek a retinue because they seek to develop beings through generosity.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re bas dben pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re bas dben pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: They seek solitude because they do not hope for the evolution of karma.

original: dkar po'i phyogs la stong pa nyid la mos pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams las brtsams pa ci dgos /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs la stong pa nyid la mos pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams las brtsams pa ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of the virtues of the bright side, such as faith in emptiness?

original: smras pa / sbyin pa la sogs pa lam gyi tshogs nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong bar sems shing byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi khyad par nyan pa la dga' bar gyur pa rnams la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa sangs rgyas su sgrub pa byang chub sems dpa'i chos mngon par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / sbyin pa la sogs pa lam gyi tshogs nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong bar sems shing byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi khyad par nyan pa la dga' bar gyur pa rnams la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa sangs rgyas su sgrub pa byang chub sems dpa'i chos mngon par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: It is said: For those who think that the collection of the path, such as generosity, is common to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and who delight in listening to the distinctive path of the bodhisattvas, in order to express the Abhidharma of the bodhisattvas, which is the attainment of buddhahood that is not common to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhi zhes gsungs so //
translated: the BhagavƒÅn taught four.

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na ste /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir bzhi kho na ste /
translated: It is said: Why are there exactly four?

original: mi mang mi nyung /
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung /
translated: Not too many, not too few.

original: smras pa / la la na re ha cang skyon du 'gyur bas klan kar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: smras pa / la la na re ha cang skyon du 'gyur bas klan kar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: It is said: Some say it is not subject to criticism because it would be too much of a fault.

original: yang rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the cause of the marvelous Dharma, there are four.

original: stong pa nyid yun ring por shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i rgyu 'dra bas skye dgu ma rig par gyur pa rnams kyi ma rig pa gdul ba'i phyir chos bstan pa na gus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yun ring por shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i rgyu 'dra bas skye dgu ma rig par gyur pa rnams kyi ma rig pa gdul ba'i phyir chos bstan pa na gus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the long and thorough cultivation of emptiness, the cause of the cultivation of emptiness for attaining omniscience is similar. Therefore, when teaching the Dharma in order to subdue the ignorance of beings who have become ignorant, they will be respectful.

original: nga rgyal med pa bdag med pa shin tu bsgoms pas /üîΩskye dgu nga rgyal dang ldan pa rnams kyi nga rgyal gdul ba'i phyir chos bstan pa na gus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa bdag med pa shin tu bsgoms pas / skye dgu nga rgyal dang ldan pa rnams kyi nga rgyal gdul ba'i phyir chos bstan pa na gus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the thorough cultivation of the absence of pride and the absence of self,üîΩwhen teaching the Dharma in order to subdue the pride of beings who are proud, they will be respectful.

original: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu zhi ba shin tu bsgoms pas skye dgu ma zhi ba rnams nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan pa la gus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu zhi ba shin tu bsgoms pas skye dgu ma zhi ba rnams nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan pa la gus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the thorough cultivation of the peaceful and transcendent intention, when teaching the Dharma in order to pacify beings who are not peaceful, they will be respectful.

original: ser sna'i gnyen po chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa shin tu bsgoms pas skye dgu len pa la dga' ba rnams kyi len pa kun du gzhom pa'i phyir chos bstan pa na gus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser sna'i gnyen po chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa shin tu bsgoms pas skye dgu len pa la dga' ba rnams kyi len pa kun du gzhom pa'i phyir chos bstan pa na gus par 'gyur ro //
translated: and by cultivating the generosity of Dharma and material gifts as the antidote to stinginess, he is respected when he teaches the Dharma in order to destroy the grasping of those who delight in grasping.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir bzhi ste /
translated: Or else, there are four because they include all the bodhisattva collections.

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs gnyis te /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva collections of bodhisattvas are twofold:

original: ye shes kyi tshogs dang bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs dang bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: the collection of wisdom and the collection of merit.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa la mos pa dang / bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa la mos pa dang / bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Thus, the collection of wisdom is the conviction in emptiness and selflessness and the intention to attain nirvana.

original: @216b las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa la sogs pa'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: @216b las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa la sogs pa'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of merit is the conviction in the evolution of karma and so on, as indicated by the remaining phrases.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis tshogs su bsdus pa'i phyir bzhi ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis tshogs su bsdus pa'i phyir bzhi ste /
translated: There are four because they include the collections of the six perfections.

original: de la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la lta zhing /
analyzed: de la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la lta zhing /
translated: They look to see whether sentient beings are ripe for being brought to full maturity.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i chos dang / zang zing gi sbyin pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i chos dang / zang zing gi sbyin pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of the perfection of generosity is the Dharma gift and the material gift, while looking at the ripening of sentient beings.

original: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The accumulation of the perfection of moral discipline is the intention of nirvana.

original: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'khor pas skyo nas ngang tshul ngan pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par sel ba rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims nyid kyis sa bon gyi chos rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'khor pas skyo nas ngang tshul ngan pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par sel ba rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims nyid kyis sa bon gyi chos rab tu 'thob po //
translated: The bodhisattva who has the intention of nirvana, having become weary of cyclic existence, by the natural moral discipline of eliminating the causes of bad character, the afflictions, attains the seed of the perfection of moral discipline.

original: bdag med pa'i bzod pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i bzod pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The accumulation of the perfection of patience is the patience of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can du 'du shes pa'i gnas nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par bsal ba'i phyir sems can gyi nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'khrugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can du 'du shes pa'i gnas nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par bsal ba'i phyir sems can gyi nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'khrugs pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses the acceptance of nonself is not disturbed by the faults of sentient beings in order to clear away their afflictions, which are the basis for the conception of sentient beings.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang / sbyor ba 'khor bar song bas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang / sbyor ba 'khor bar song bas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The accumulation of the perfection of effort is by means of confidence in the ripening of karma and by means of application in samsara.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa la yid ches pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal mi zad pas nyen pa'i sems can rnams la lta ba dang bstan pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i 'khor
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa la yid ches pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal mi zad pas nyen pa'i sems can rnams la lta ba dang bstan pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i 'khor
translated: The bodhisattva who has confidence in the result of the accumulation of merit and wisdom, which is omniscience, is not discouraged by the suffering of samsara due to seeing and teaching sentient beings who are tormented by the suffering of samsara.

original: ba nyid du sbyor ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par spel ba'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po rtsom mo //
analyzed: ba nyid du sbyor ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par spel ba'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po rtsom mo //
translated: Application in samsara is the great exertion of effort in order to increase the roots of virtue.

original: snying rje che bas ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: snying rje che bas ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The accumulation of the perfection of meditation is due to great compassion,

original: snying rje chen po ni rtsa ba'i bsam gtan du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni rtsa ba'i bsam gtan du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because great compassion is included in the basic meditation.

original: stong pa nyid la mos pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mos pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of the perfection of wisdom is due to the aspiration for emptiness.

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa'i gnas te mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa'i gnas te mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva's true foundation is due to not forsaking the thought of awakening, because it is nondeceptive.

original: de'i grogs ni snying rje chen po dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang / sbyor ba 'khor bar song ba ste /
analyzed: de'i grogs ni snying rje chen po dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang / sbyor ba 'khor bar song ba ste /
translated: Its helpers are great compassion, confidence in the evolution of karma, and application in the samsara.

original: sems can gyi bya ba mthar thug par byed pas phyin ci ma log par 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can gyi bya ba mthar thug par byed pas phyin ci ma log par 'jug go //
translated: One engages in them without error because one brings sentient beings' activities to completion.

original: de lta bas na snying rje chen po dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang / sbyor ba 'khor bar sang bas ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos 'di dag ni bden pa'i gnas su blta'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na snying rje chen po dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang / sbyor ba 'khor bar sang bas ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos 'di dag ni bden pa'i gnas su blta'o //
translated: Therefore, these things should be seen as the basis of truth, because great compassion, confidence in the ripening of karma, and practice in samsara are the causes for not abandoning the Thought of Awakening.

original: bden pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis @217a * //
analyzed: bden pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis @217a * //
translated: And the truth is that the bodhisattvas

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong bar gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong bar gnas so //
translated: do not abandon the Thought of Awakening.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gtong ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gtong ba'i gnas te /
translated: The Dharma of not hoping for the ripening of karma and the generosity of material things is the basis of giving.

original: gtong ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos dang zang zing la ser sna byed pa tshar gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtong ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos dang zang zing la ser sna byed pa tshar gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Giving is what overcomes the stinginess of bodhisattvas with regard to Dharma and material things.

original: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ;
analyzed: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ;
translated: The intention of nirvana

original: nye bar zhi ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba'i gnas te /
translated: is the basis of peace.

original: nye bar zhi ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nye bar ma zhi ba tshar gcod pas bsam gtan la sogs pa ste 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nye bar ma zhi ba tshar gcod pas bsam gtan la sogs pa ste 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Peace is the cause of the accomplishment of the meditative concentrations, etc. for the bodhisattvas, since it is the pacification of their nonpeace.

original: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa la mos pa ni shes rab kyi gnas te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa la mos pa ni shes rab kyi gnas te /
translated: The conviction of emptiness and selflessness is the abode of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon pas spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas su grub kyi bar du byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam par sbyor ba 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon pas spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas su grub kyi bar du byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam par sbyor ba 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Because the bodhisattvas, by means of wisdom, destroy the passions and increase the growth of the roots of virtue which are conducive to the attainment of enlightenment until they become buddhas.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i chos dang zang zing sbyin pa ni byams pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i chos dang zang zing sbyin pa ni byams pa ste /
translated: The gift of Dharma and material goods without hope of karmic reward is love,

original: gzhan dag la phan 'dogs par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la phan 'dogs par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is engaged in benefiting others.

original: snying rje bas ni snying rje nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje bas ni snying rje nyid do //
translated: Compassion is compassion itself.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches par 'khor bar sbyor ba na sems can gyi don bya ba la gzhol ba gzhan la phan pa 'grub pa'i phyir sems rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches par 'khor bar sbyor ba na sems can gyi don bya ba la gzhol ba gzhan la phan pa 'grub pa'i phyir sems rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the delight of the mind in working for the welfare of sentient beings, in order to accomplish the benefit of others, while one is engaged in cyclic existence, because one has confidence in the evolution of karma, since great compassion precedes it.

original: yang na bsam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnam par bstsal te /
analyzed: yang na bsam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnam par bstsal te /
translated: Alternatively, the intention is the elimination of the afflictions in order to attain nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba med pas sems rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba med pas sems rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the delight of the mind that is free of the distress of the afflictions.

original: yang na 'du byed rnams la bdag med pas dpyod pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dad pa rab tu thob pas /
analyzed: yang na 'du byed rnams la bdag med pas dpyod pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dad pa rab tu thob pas /
translated: Alternatively, joy is the delight of the mind that is attained by one who has attained faith that accords with the Dharma, by investigating the selflessness of conditioned phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi tshogs rjes su dran nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi tshogs rjes su dran nas /
translated: Having recalled the multitude of the Lord‚Äôs virtues,

original: sems rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: one‚Äôs mind is delighted.

original: yang na 'byung ba mthong bas rang gi mthu thob ste /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba mthong bas rang gi mthu thob ste /
translated: Alternatively, joy is the delight of the mind that is attained by one who has seen the truth and who has attained his own stage.

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba'i 'jig rten la brtags nas 'khor ba'i 'dam chen po ma rig pa las 'jig rten bton te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba'i 'jig rten la brtags nas 'khor ba'i 'dam chen po ma rig pa las 'jig rten bton te /
translated: I can pull the world out of the mire of great cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'i dbyings su 'jog nus so snyam pa'am sems can gyi tshogs bsgral ba la lta bas gzhan la phan par bya bar nus pa ni gzhan la phan par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'i dbyings su 'jog nus so snyam pa'am sems can gyi tshogs bsgral ba la lta bas gzhan la phan par bya bar nus pa ni gzhan la phan par sbyor ba ste /
translated: or, seeing that he can liberate the multitude of sentient beings, he thinks, I can benefit others.

original: phan par sbyor ba'i phyir /üîΩgzhan la phan par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: phan par sbyor ba'i phyir / gzhan la phan par byed pa 'am /
translated: The application to benefit is so called because it is the application to benefit.üîΩIt is the application to benefit others,

original: nus pa 'am /
analyzed: nus pa 'am /
translated: or the capacity to benefit others,

original: sems can gyi tshogs bde bar gyur pa nyid mthong nas sems can rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs bde bar gyur pa nyid mthong nas sems can rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: or the joy of the bodhisattva when he sees the multitude of sentient beings become happy.

original: 'du byed stong pa rnams la rab tu rtog pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed stong pa rnams la rab tu rtog pa ni /
translated: The realization of conditioned states as empty

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba @217b med pas mnyam pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba @217b med pas mnyam pa nyid thob ste /
translated: is the attainment of equanimity through the absence of attachment and hostility.

original: sems can gyi las rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rnams la lhun gyis grub nas btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bzhin du btang snyoms so //
analyzed: sems can gyi las rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rnams la lhun gyis grub nas btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bzhin du btang snyoms so //
translated: It is equanimity, like the limb of enlightenment of equanimity, because it is spontaneously accomplished and indifferent with regard to the dharmas that are the results of the sentient beings' actions.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is generosity, because it is not expecting any karmic reward.

original: chos dang zang zing sbyin pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing sbyin pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: It is speaking pleasantly, because it is the giving of Dharma and material things.

original: snying rjes sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa ni don dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: snying rjes sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa ni don dpyod pa'o //
translated: It is working for the benefit of sentient beings, because it is the accomplishment of the aims of sentient beings through compassion.

original: tshig lhag ma rnams ni sems can la phan pa sgrub par zhugs pa'i phyir don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams ni sems can la phan pa sgrub par zhugs pa'i phyir don mthun pa'o //
translated: The remaining words are the same as the above, because they are engaged in accomplishing the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad yongs su bsdus pas bzhi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad yongs su bsdus pas bzhi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the fourfold collection of the bodhisattvas.

original: ston pa nyid kyi don brjod dgos so //üîΩsmras pa / shes rab kyis rab tu brtags nas 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ston pa nyid kyi don brjod dgos so // smras pa / shes rab kyis rab tu brtags nas 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the teacher himself should be stated.üîΩIt is emptiness, because it is the non-apprehension of the nature of the formative forces through the thorough investigation of wisdom.

original: smras pa / kye ci shes rab kyis 'du byed rnams 'jig gam /
analyzed: smras pa / kye ci shes rab kyis 'du byed rnams 'jig gam /
translated: It is signlessness, because it is the non-apprehension of the sign of the formative forces.

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: Objection: No, they are not.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa ni mtshan ma'i spyod yul gyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i yul don dam par med pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni mtshan ma'i spyod yul gyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i yul don dam par med pa /
translated: Consciousness is the domain of signs. The object of consciousness does not exist ultimately.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags par gnas pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags par gnas pa /
translated: It is a false superimposition.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang ba'i sa la rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab bzod pa chung du nas bzung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang ba'i sa la rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab bzod pa chung du nas bzung ste /
translated: In the stage of purifying unreal things, consciousness and the wisdom that arises simultaneously with it, beginning with lesser patience,üîΩare gradually destroyed by the process of distinguishing greater, middling, and lesser stages, up to the stage of the lineage.

original: rigs kyi sa'i dus kyi bar du chen po dang / 'bring dang / phra mo rab tu 'byed pa'i rim gyis rnam par bshig nas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rkyen du 'gyur bas 'gag go //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa'i dus kyi bar du chen po dang / 'bring dang / phra mo rab tu 'byed pa'i rim gyis rnam par bshig nas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rkyen du 'gyur bas 'gag go //
translated: They cease because they become the condition for uncontaminated wisdom.

original: des na don dam pa mthong ba'i bar du gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan ma'i spyod yul gyi rnam par shes pa rkyen med pas don dam pa'i yul yin pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings mthong ngo //
analyzed: des na don dam pa mthong ba'i bar du gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan ma'i spyod yul gyi rnam par shes pa rkyen med pas don dam pa'i yul yin pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, since the consciousness that has the appearance of the objective realm, which is the cause of obstructing the vision of the ultimate, is not a condition, it is the object of the ultimate. Therefore, by uncontaminated wisdom, one sees the realm of signlessness.

original: chos kyi dbyings mthong bas skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mthong bas skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
translated: By seeing the realm of phenomena, one enters into the faultless.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mthong bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mthong bas ni ma yin no //
translated: But one does not see by means of its own characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul lam yin na ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul lam yin na ni /
translated: If it were the object of its own characteristic,

original: rnam par shes pa dang bye brag med pa'i phyir chos kyis de bo na de mtshungs pas 'jig rten ni rnam par shes pas don byas pa'i phyir lam bsgom pa don med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bye brag med pa'i phyir chos kyis de bo na de mtshungs pas 'jig rten ni rnam par shes pas don byas pa'i phyir lam bsgom pa don med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because it would be no different from consciousness, the world would have no reason to cultivate the path, because consciousness would have already accomplished its purpose.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa la shes rab ces zer na ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa la shes rab ces zer na ni mi rung ste /
translated: If it is said that consciousness is wisdom, that is not correct.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it apprehends its own characteristic.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: This is how it is.

original: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir shes pa ni rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir shes pa ni rnam pa yin te /
translated: Because it has the characteristic of wisdom, consciousness is a mode.

original: shes rab kyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par rab tu shes so //
translated: For by means of wisdom one knows the specific characteristics of impermanence, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩrnam par @218a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid do // rnam par @218a * //
translated: Consciousness has the characteristic of the bare awareness of an object.üîΩConsciousness is not a mode,

original: shes pa'i don byas pa'i de bas na rnam par shes pa dang bye brag med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i don byas pa'i de bas na rnam par shes pa dang bye brag med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: because it has the characteristic of the bare awareness of an object.

original: de rigs te /
analyzed: de rigs te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // gal te rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it has the characteristic of the apprehension of a specific thing.üîΩIf it were a mode because it has the characteristic of the apprehension of a specific thing,

original: shes rab kyi yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: the object of wisdom would be a specific thing,

original: des rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par ni mi 'thad do //
translated: and it would not be tenable that it apprehends a specific thing.

original: ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid kyang 'dzin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma bor bas dngos po rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid kyang 'dzin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma bor bas dngos po rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it were to apprehend a specific thing, it would not abandon its specific thing and would have the characteristic of the bare awareness of an object.

original: rnam par shes pa bye brag med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bye brag med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be the fault of the non-distinction of consciousness.

original: gal te rnam par shas pa'i rjes su 'jug cas zar na yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shas pa'i rjes su 'jug cas zar na yang mi rung ste /
translated: If you say that it is the subsequent consciousness that is the apprehender, that is not tenable.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of contradiction.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: This is how it is:

original: shes rab ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Wisdom is the condition that arises simultaneously with consciousness.

original: de ni dngos po'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i spyod yul lo //
translated: It has a real object.üîΩBecause it is subsequent to that, wisdom apprehends its own characteristic, impermanence, etc.

original: de rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab kyis rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pas 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir shes rab kyis rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pas 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: That is also untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because of contradiction.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pas gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pas gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because the characteristics of the particular and the universal are incompatible, form itself is impermanence.

original: gal te gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin na ni shes rab kyis 'dzin par 'gyur na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin na ni shes rab kyis 'dzin par 'gyur na ma yin te /
translated: If form itself were impermanence, it would be apprehended by wisdom, but it is not.

original: de bas na shes rab ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, wisdom does not apprehend its own characteristic.

original: rnam par shes pa yang shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug pas de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug pas de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: And consciousness, because it is engaged in wisdom, becomes its nature.

original: don dam pa'i yul yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid 'dor ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i yul yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid 'dor ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is the object of the ultimate, the error of abandoning its own characteristic would follow.

original: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid shes rab kyi yul lam /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid shes rab kyi yul lam /
translated: Therefore, the own characteristic is not the object of wisdom.

original: don dam pa rnam par shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: don dam pa rnam par shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Nor is the ultimate the object of consciousness.

original: smras pa / kye ci stong pa nyid la mos pas las kyi rnam pa la yid ches pa la gnod de /
analyzed: smras pa / kye ci stong pa nyid la mos pas las kyi rnam pa la yid ches pa la gnod de /
translated: Objection: But if one is devoted to emptiness, is one not harmed by the varieties of karma?

original: des na las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa zhes de skad brjod dam /
analyzed: des na las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa zhes de skad brjod dam /
translated: So why is it said that one has confidence in the ripening of karma?

original: smras pa / srid pas so sor brjod pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: smras pa / srid pas so sor brjod pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Response: There is no fault in stating it in terms of existence.

original: 'di la shes rab kyis 'du byed rnams rab tu rnam par bshig nas sems can mi dmigs pa ni 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin med pa dang / g-yo med par rig nas /
analyzed: 'di la shes rab kyis 'du byed rnams rab tu rnam par bshig nas sems can mi dmigs pa ni 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin med pa dang / g-yo med par rig nas /
translated: Here, having thoroughly destroyed compounded phenomena with wisdom, one does not observe sentient beings. Having understood that compounded phenomena are without intrinsic reality and are without movement,

original: rkyen 'di la mi mkhas pa ni 'du byed rnams gnas pa med la g-yo ba med na byed pa ni gang 'bras bu dang 'brel ba ni gang zhes kun du gti mug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen 'di la mi mkhas pa ni 'du byed rnams gnas pa med la g-yo ba med na byed pa ni gang 'bras bu dang 'brel ba ni gang zhes kun du gti mug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not skilled in this condition are completely confused, thinking, ‚ÄúIf compounded phenomena are neither stationary nor moving, then what is the agent and what is the result that is related?‚Äù

original: kun du gti mug pas las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid mi ches par 'gyur ro //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba la gnas pa'i rab tsam bla'i /

original: dpa'i bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pas zil gyis non pas 'khor ba gnod pa mang por shes nas 'khor bas skyo ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa mya ngan las 'das kyang snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can la
analyzed: dpa'i bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pas zil gyis non pas 'khor ba gnod pa mang por shes nas 'khor bas skyo ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa mya ngan las 'das kyang snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can la

original: 'dus byas pa la gnas nas so //

analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' chos la lta bas byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba mthong yang yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, seeing the bodhisattva in sa·πÉsƒÅra through the view of dharmas, embraces him.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: For example, the Blessed One said:

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na nam mkha' las sa bon rnams mi 'khrung ngo zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Seeds do not grow in the sky.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du bshad dgos so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du bshad dgos so //
translated: And for the sake of ripening beings, it is said that giving is for the sake of ripening beings.

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa'i chu'i rlan gyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i zhing brlan par gyur pa rnams la thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyor ba nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i drod kyi sbyor ba nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i me'i dugs kyis bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bonüîΩrab tu gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa'i chu'i rlan gyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i zhing brlan par gyur pa rnams la thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyor ba nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i drod kyi sbyor ba nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i me'i dugs kyis bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon rab tu gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: For those sentient beings whose fields of thought are moistened by the moisture of the water of the afflictions, the fire of the roots of virtue that is conducive to penetration, which is the application of heat, is the means of planting the seeds of the roots of uncontaminated virtue in accordance with their thoughts.üîΩBecause it plants the seeds of the roots of uncontaminated virtue in accordance with their thoughts, it is called the field of the roots of virtue.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa'i zhing rnams kun du smin par byed pas yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa'i zhing rnams kun du smin par byed pas yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: Because it ripens the fields of sentient beings' thoughts, it is called ripening.

original: don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang thabs la mkhas pa phun sum tshogs pa ni sems can gyi rgyud yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud do //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang thabs la mkhas pa phun sum tshogs pa ni sems can gyi rgyud yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is intent on the perfection of generosity, who is endowed with compassion and skillful means, attracts sentient beings with the generosity of Dharma and material things in order to ripen their mind-streams.

original: bsdus nas kyang bsam pa dang 'tsham par theg pa gsum po dag la ci rigs par yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: bsdus nas kyang bsam pa dang 'tsham par theg pa gsum po dag la ci rigs par yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: And having gathered them, he ripens them in the three vehicles, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: smras pa / sbyin pa zhes bya ba de ci zhig / smras pa /üîΩma chags pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / sbyin pa zhes bya ba de ci zhig / smras pa / ma chags pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa ste /
translated: It was said: ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called generosity?‚Äù

original: byung ba dang lhan cig pa /
analyzed: byung ba dang lhan cig pa /
translated: It was said: ‚ÄúIt is the intention that is born together with nonattachment.üîΩIt is the simultaneous arising of the intention that is born together with nonattachment and the object to be given.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa rnams kyis sbyin pa'i chos kyi gnas la 'jug pa ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa rnams kyis sbyin pa'i chos kyi gnas la 'jug pa ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: The engagement in the object of giving by those who have the same result is generosity.

original: rnam par smin pa la yang mi re zhes bya ba ni de la rnam pa sna tshogs su smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la yang mi re zhes bya ba ni de la rnam pa sna tshogs su smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not hope for a karmic maturation‚Äù means that the various kinds of maturation are the karmic maturation.

original: 'bras bu sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is a synonym for ‚Äúvarious results.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ni rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ni rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ste /
translated: Not hoping for a karmic maturation is not hoping for a karmic maturation.

original: bdag bde ba la mi lta ba'i phyir 'bras bu la mngon par 'dod pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag bde ba la mi lta ba'i phyir 'bras bu la mngon par 'dod pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is a synonym for ‚Äúnot desiring a result‚Äù because one does not look to one‚Äôs own happiness.

original: smras @220b pa ;
analyzed: smras @220b pa ;
translated: It was said:

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la lta ba'i sbyin pas rnam par smin pa la mi re ba nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la lta ba'i sbyin pas rnam par smin pa la mi re ba nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not taught that generosity is for the sake of seeing the full maturation of sentient beings, and that one should not hope for karmic maturation?

original: ci'i phyir yang rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i zhes zlos par brjod /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i zhes zlos par brjod /
translated: Why is it said again that one should not hope for karmic maturation?

original: smras pa / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la lta ba'i sbyin pa la yang rnam par smin pa la yang mi re ba srid do //
analyzed: smras pa / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la lta ba'i sbyin pa la yang rnam par smin pa la yang mi re ba srid do //
translated: It is said: It is possible that generosity for the sake of seeing the full maturation of sentient beings does not hope for karmic maturation.

original: so sor bshad pas nyes pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor bshad pas nyes pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no fault in explaining it separately.

original: gang yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed nas sems can thams cad la dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed nas sems can thams cad la dmigs te /
translated: Having generated the mind for enlightenment, one focuses on all sentient beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la lta bas sbyin pa byin pa ni 'khor ba na 'bras bu rgya che ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la lta bas sbyin pa byin pa ni 'khor ba na 'bras bu rgya che ba yin te /
translated: Generosity given for the sake of seeing the full maturation of sentient beings has vast results in cyclic existence.

original: tha mar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs 'di ni 'bras bu rgya che ba'o snyam pa sems can la mngon par phyogs pa'i sbyin pa yang bsam pas don dam par rig nas de bzlog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan la gzud pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa la mi re ba zhes de skad du gsungs so //
analyzed: tha mar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs 'di ni 'bras bu rgya che ba'o snyam pa sems can la mngon par phyogs pa'i sbyin pa yang bsam pas don dam par rig nas de bzlog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan la gzud pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa la mi re ba zhes de skad du gsungs so //
translated: Having understood the ultimate meaning in this way, in order to reverse that and in order to introduce to the true qualities of a bodhisattva, it is said, without hope for the fruitional effect.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi bde ba la lta bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rang gi rgyud la rnam par smin par smon pa med do //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi bde ba la lta bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rang gi rgyud la rnam par smin par smon pa med do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is perfect in intention does not aspire for the fruitional effect of generosity and so on in his own continuum, viewing it as his own happiness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la mi lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la mi lta ste /
translated: Because he does not look to cause and effect.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sangs rgyas su grub par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sangs rgyas su grub par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o zhes ston to //
translated: In order to benefit others, he dedicates the roots of virtue to the attainment of buddhahood.

original: de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: gal te srid na ni thams can mkhyen pa bsgrubs te /
analyzed: gal te srid na ni thams can mkhyen pa bsgrubs te /
translated: If it were possible, then having accomplished omniscience,

original: sems can re re la yang sbyin pa zhig na 'di na chos rnams kyi chos nyid de rang gi sems la 'bras bu grub mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can re re la yang sbyin pa zhig na 'di na chos rnams kyi chos nyid de rang gi sems la 'bras bu grub mod kyi /
translated: even if one gave to each sentient being, still the reality of phenomena would be established in one‚Äôs own mind.

original: 'on kyang bdag gis thams cad mkhyen pa ni gzhan gyi don nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis thams cad mkhyen pa ni gzhan gyi don nyid de /
translated: However, my omniscience is for the sake of others.

original: thabs de gzhan la phan par nus pa'i phyir ro snyam mo //
analyzed: thabs de gzhan la phan par nus pa'i phyir ro snyam mo //
translated: That method is able to benefit others.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de'i bsam pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa dag dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'brel pa 'bras bu gyur pa /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de'i bsam pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa dag dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'brel pa 'bras bu gyur pa /
translated: Thus, in order to purify the intention of that bodhisattva, all the causes that bring about omniscience, such as generosity, and all the results that are related to omniscience,

original: stobs la sogs pa gang yin pa thams cad gzhan la phan par bya ba'i bsam pa gang yin pas de'i gzhan la phan par bya ba la mngon par phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa gang yin pa thams cad gzhan la phan par bya ba'i bsam pa gang yin pas de'i gzhan la phan par bya ba la mngon par phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: such as the powers, are directed toward benefiting others by the intention to benefit others.

original: de bas na de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'di ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi tshogs kyi sbyin pa ni rgyud yongs su smin par bya @221a * //
analyzed: de bas na de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ste / 'di ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi tshogs kyi sbyin pa ni rgyud yongs su smin par bya @221a * //
translated: Therefore, it is called the bodhisattva's true virtue, because it is not common to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.üîΩThus, the giving of the bodhisattva is not given for the sake of one's own happiness in the future, nor for the sake of wealth, nor for the sake of a heavenly rebirth, nor for the sake of physical maturity.

original: ba'i phyir sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: ba'i phyir sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: The giving of the sravaka and pratyekabuddha is given for the sake of maturing one's own continuum.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa dag ni 'bras bu 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa dag ni 'bras bu 'dod do //
translated: Those outside this teaching give for the sake of a result.

original: log par sgrub pa'i gnyen por yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i legs pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas bzhi phrag bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i gnyen por yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i legs pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas bzhi phrag bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The four groups of four verses should be understood as the remedy for wrong practice, in terms of the excellence of right practice.

original: legs pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: legs pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of excellence?

original: gter chen po rnyed pa'i phyir phyug pa dang ; bdud las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir phyir rgol ba med pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med par dgon pa la gnas pa la sogs pas longs spyod pa kha nam thob med pa dang / bsod nams kyi chogs dpag tu med pas bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: gter chen po rnyed pa'i phyir phyug pa dang ; bdud las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir phyir rgol ba med pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med par dgon pa la gnas pa la sogs pas longs spyod pa kha nam thob med pa dang / bsod nams kyi chogs dpag tu med pas bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa'o //
translated: Because he has found the great treasure, he is wealthy. Because he has completely transcended the works of Mara, he is without adversaries. Because he dwells in the forest, etc., without hypocrisy, he is without deceit. Because his merit is immeasurable, his merit is inexhaustible.

original: legs pa 'di rnams kyi go rims ni thog ma kho nar gter rnyed pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sog ste /
analyzed: legs pa 'di rnams kyi go rims ni thog ma kho nar gter rnyed pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sog ste /
translated: The order of these excellences is as follows: First, by finding the treasure, he accumulates the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: de la sangs rgyas su 'byung ba ma nyes bar byed pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas su 'byung ba ma nyes bar byed pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: Of these, the store of merit is the cause of his birth as a Buddha.

original: chig lhag ma gsum po dag ni ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: chig lhag ma gsum po dag ni ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: The remaining three stores are the store of knowledge.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa la brten nas bzhi pa gnyis pas bdud las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir sgrib pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa la brten nas bzhi pa gnyis pas bdud las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir sgrib pa rnam par dag go //
translated: On the basis of the store of merit, he completely transcends the works of Mara by means of the fourth and fifth excellences, and thus his obscurations are purified.

original: bsgom pa rnam par dag pa la brten nas bzhi pa gsum pa dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud pa'i phyir sgo thams cad nas dkar po'i chos 'thob po //
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam par dag pa la brten nas bzhi pa gsum pa dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud pa'i phyir sgo thams cad nas dkar po'i chos 'thob po //
translated: On the basis of the purity of meditation, in the fourth and third stages, he obtains all the virtuous qualities through all the doors, in order to gather all virtuous qualities.

original: sgo thams cad nas dkar po'i chos thob pa la brten nas bzhi pa bzhi pas bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'thob pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don du sbyor te /
analyzed: sgo thams cad nas dkar po'i chos thob pa la brten nas bzhi pa bzhi pas bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'thob pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don du sbyor te /
translated: On the basis of the acquisition of all the virtuous qualities through all the doors, in the fourth stage, he is engaged in the welfare of all beings in every way, in order to obtain immeasurable merit.

original: bsod nams tshad med pa bskyed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams tshad med pa bskyed par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that he generates immeasurable merit.

original: gter chen po rnyed pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: gter chen po rnyed pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four discoveries of great treasures are:

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed pa ni //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par rig par bya'o // de la sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed pa ni //
translated: reliance on holy persons, listening to the holy Dharma, proper attention, and practice in accordance with the Dharma.

original: skyes bud ma pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bud ma pa la brten pa'o //
translated: Therein, the discovery of the Buddha is the discovery of a great treasure, because the Buddha is a great treasure of all qualities.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyan pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyan pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa'o //
translated: The discovery of the Dharma is the discovery of a great treasure, because the Dharma is a great treasure of the results of virtue.üîΩThe discovery of the Sangha is the discovery of a great treasure, because the Sangha is a great treasure of the results of virtue.

original: bdud bzhi ni theg pa chen po la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa byang chub kyi sems 'dor ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa byed pa'i sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa sems can thams cad la khong khro ba'i sems dang / ma nor bar sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa lta bar gyur pa thams cad la mi rtog pa dang /
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni theg pa chen po la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa byang chub kyi sems 'dor ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa byed pa'i sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa sems can thams cad la khong khro ba'i sems dang / ma nor bar sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa lta bar gyur pa thams cad la mi rtog pa dang /
translated: The four demons are: the demon that causes one to abandon the Thought of Enlightenment, which is an obstacle to application to the Great Vehicle; the demon that causes one to be angry with all sentient beings, which is an obstacle to application to the ripening of sentient beings;

original: yongs su rtog par sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i sems can thams cad la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can no //
analyzed: yongs su rtog par sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i sems can thams cad la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can no //
translated: the demon that causes one to be conceited about all sentient beings, which is an obstacle to application to the thorough understanding of all sentient beings.

original: de las bzlog pa ni bdag nyid theg pa chen po las mi g-yos pa dang / sems can thams cad la mi sgrub pa'i zhi yongs su spong ba dang / log par sgrub pa'i gzhi rnam par spong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bar yang dag par sgrub pa'i gzhi yongs su spong bas bdud las shin tu 'da' bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni bdag nyid theg pa chen po las mi g-yos pa dang / sems can thams cad la mi sgrub pa'i zhi yongs su spong ba dang / log par sgrub pa'i gzhi rnam par spong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bar yang dag par sgrub pa'i gzhi yongs su spong bas bdud las shin tu 'da' bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the opposite of those is the transcending of the demons: by not wavering from the Great Vehicle oneself; by abandoning the peace which is not established for all sentient beings; by abandoning the basis of wrong practice; and by abandoning the basis of incomplete practice.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sdud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas chos bzhi po dag dge ba'i chos sdud par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sdud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas chos bzhi po dag dge ba'i chos sdud par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The four dharmas should be understood as causing the gathering of virtuous dharmas in terms of four kinds of virtue.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa ste /
translated: The first is the virtue of the stage of meditative concentration.

original: bsgom pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The second is the virtue of the stage of nonconcentration, which is threefold:

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / bya dka' ba spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / thos pa dang sems pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / bya dka' ba spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / thos pa dang sems pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: the virtue of following the development of living beings, the virtue of following the performance of difficult tasks, and the virtue of following learning and reflection.

original: tshul 'chos pa med par dgon pa la gnas te bsgom pas ni bsgom pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dge ba ston to //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa med par dgon pa la gnas te bsgom pas ni bsgom pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dge ba ston to //
translated: The virtue of following meditative concentration is shown by the practice of meditation in the forest without hypocrisy.

original: lan du phan 'dogs par re ba med par sems can smin par byed par sbyor bas ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs par re ba med par sems can smin par byed par sbyor bas ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: One is engaged in maturing sentient beings without hoping for any reward, so one is engaged in the maturation of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la lus dang srog gtong zhing dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba'i rtsom pas ni dka' ba spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //üîΩthos pa dang don gyis ngoms mi myong zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lus dang srog gtong zhing dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba'i rtsom pas ni dka' ba spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o // thos pa dang don gyis ngoms mi myong zhing /
translated: One is engaged in seeking the holy Dharma by giving up one's body and life for all sentient beings, so one is engaged in the practice of austerities.
One is not satisfied with listening to and reflecting on the Dharma,

original: ba'i rtsa ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i brtson 'grus kyis ni thos pa dang / sems pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i brtson 'grus kyis ni thos pa dang / sems pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: and one is engaged in listening to and reflecting on the Dharma by the perseverance of gathering all the wholesome roots.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four immeasurable collections of merit for the bodhisattva.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams gnas bzhi las rnam par gnon pa'i dbang du byas nas bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams gnas bzhi las rnam par gnon pa'i dbang du byas nas bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth, in terms of the bodhisattva's supremacy over the four abodes of sentient beings.

original: bzhi po gang dag las shen som nyi dang yid gnyis dang / the tshom dang / ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dang / theg pa chung du la mos pa dang / bstan pa la gnod par sems shing khong khro ba las so //
analyzed: bzhi po gang dag las shen som nyi dang yid gnyis dang / the tshom dang / ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dang / theg pa chung du la mos pa dang / bstan pa la gnod par sems shing khong khro ba las so //
translated: and the lower realms, the unfortunate destinies, and the Lesser Vehicle.

original: de la zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos byin pas na som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang ; the tshom las bzlog go //
analyzed: de la zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos byin pas na som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang ; the tshom las bzlog go //
translated: By giving the Dharma with a disinterested mind, he turns them away from doubt, uncertainty, and skepticism.

original: ngan tshul ngan pa rnams la cher snying rje bas ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung pa las bzlog go //
analyzed: ngan tshul ngan pa rnams la cher snying rje bas ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung pa las bzlog go //
translated: By having great compassion for those who are in bad physical condition and have bad behavior, he turns them away from the lower realms, the unfortunate destinies, and the bad migrations.

original: sems can thams cad la byang chub kyi sems ston pas ni theg pa chung du la mos pa las bzlog go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byang chub kyi sems ston pas ni theg pa chung du la mos pa las bzlog go //
translated: By teaching the thought of awakening to all sentient beings, he turns them away from the aspiration to the Lesser Vehicle.

original: nyam chung ba rnams la bzod pas sten pas ni bstan pa la gnod par sems shing /üîΩkhong khro ba las bzlog ste /
analyzed: nyam chung ba rnams la bzod pas sten pas ni bstan pa la gnod par sems shing / khong khro ba las bzlog ste /
translated: By being patient and helpful to the weak, he turns them away from the thought to harm the teaching.

original: nyam chung ba rnams rjes su ma srung bas bstan pa la khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: nyam chung ba rnams rjes su ma srung bas bstan pa la khong khro ba'o //
translated: They think to harm the teaching because they do not protect the weak.

original: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa'i ni ming tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde'i mtshams sbyor ba rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa'i ni ming tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde'i mtshams sbyor ba rtsom mo //
translated: This is the introduction to the sutra, in order to teach the classification of correct practice.

original: chos spyod pa la sogs pa smos pas ni khyad par dang / khyad par med pa dang / gtogs pa dang thabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos spyod pa la sogs pa smos pas ni khyad par dang / khyad par med pa dang / gtogs pa dang thabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By mentioning the practice of the Dharma, etc., he teaches the distinctive, the non-distinctive, the included, and the means.

original: chos spyod pa ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: chos spyod pa ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: The practice of the Dharma is distinctive from that of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa khyad par du ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa khyad par du ston to //
translated: The bodhisattva practice is taught as distinctive.

original: snyoms par spyod pas ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid pas sems can thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa khyad par med pa ston to //
analyzed: snyoms par spyod pas ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid pas sems can thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa khyad par med pa ston to //
translated: By equal practice, the bodhisattva practice is taught as non-distinctive for all beings, due to the equality of self and others.

original: dge ba sbyor bas ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gtogs par ston te /
analyzed: dge ba sbyor bas ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gtogs par ston te /
translated: By applying virtue, the bodhisattva practice is taught as included.

original: dge ba shin tu rnam par dag pa mthar phyin pas sangs rgyas su 'grub par gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba shin tu rnam par dag pa mthar phyin pas sangs rgyas su 'grub par gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ultimate, perfectly pure virtue is included in the accomplishment of Buddhahood.

original: chos la gnas pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di'i thabs ston to //
analyzed: chos la gnas pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di'i thabs ston to //
translated: The practice of Dharma shows the method of this bodhisattva practice.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa ni khyad par rnam pa lngas nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags par ston te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa ni khyad par rnam pa lngas nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags par ston te /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva practice of Dharma is shown as superior to the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. by five kinds of distinctions.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The intention of benefit and happiness for all sentient beings is the distinction of intention.

original: bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bsam pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva of pure intention has the intention to benefit and gladden all sentient beings as if they were himself.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. do not.

original: sbyor ba'i khyad par rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khyad par rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of distinctions of application.

original: @222b thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud ces bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'dzud kyi nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @222b thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud ces bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'dzud kyi nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase they introduce them to the knowledge of an Omniscient One means that Bodhisattvas introduce sentient beings to the knowledge of an Omniscient One, but not Hearers and so forth.

original: bdag ci re zhes yongs su 'jal zhing bdag gi shes pa la mi smod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag ci re zhes yongs su 'jal zhing bdag gi shes pa la mi smod ces bya ba la /
translated: The phrase they examine themselves, thinking 'What if I were to do this?' and they do not disparage their own knowledge means that

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i bye brag mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i bye brag mkhyen gyi /
translated: Bodhisattvas know the difference between themselves and Hearers and so forth.

original: nyan thos la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya brag mi shes so //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya brag mi shes so //
translated: But Hearers and so forth do not know the difference between a Bodhisattva and themselves.

original: nga rgyal med ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pas de rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin yang /
analyzed: nga rgyal med ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pas de rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin yang /
translated: The phrase they are free of pride means that because Bodhisattvas realize the selflessness of phenomena, they are not afflicted by the destruction of that,

original: nga rgyal med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa yin gyi /
translated: and they are free of pride.

original: nyan thos rnams ni bdag cag sbyin gnas kyi bye brag yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni bdag cag sbyin gnas kyi bye brag yin no snyam mo //
translated: But Hearers think, 'We are the ones who are special as objects of generosity.'

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase they have a firm superior motivation means that

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don sbyor ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don sbyor ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattvas are firm in their superior intention to work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: nyan thos rnams ni sems can gyi don btang nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni sems can gyi don btang nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But the disciples, having given up working for the welfare of sentient beings, are intent on passing into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de la snyoms par spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid brgyad kyis ston to //
analyzed: de la snyoms par spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid brgyad kyis ston to //
translated: The practice of equanimity is taught by the eight equanimities of the bodhisattvas.

original: mdza' ba mnyam pa ni gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: mdza' ba mnyam pa ni gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The equanimity of affection is divided into three:

original: bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / dus kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / dus kyi bye brag go //
translated: the difference of intention, the difference of application, and the difference of time.

original: bcos pa ma yin par byams pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing med pa'i bsam pa ston to //
analyzed: bcos pa ma yin par byams pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing med pa'i bsam pa ston to //
translated: The affection that is not artificial teaches the intention that is free of material desires.

original: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba la sems snyoms zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa rnams la snyoms par sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba la sems snyoms zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa rnams la snyoms par sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: The equanimity of mind toward friends and foes teaches the equanimity of application to those who help and those who harm.

original: mya ngal las 'das pa'i mtha'i bar du rab tu mdza' ba zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du mdza' bar ston to //
analyzed: mya ngal las 'das pa'i mtha'i bar du rab tu mdza' ba zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du mdza' bar ston to //
translated: The affection that lasts until the end of the world teaches affection that lasts for all time.

original: tshig tshod 'dzin cing 'dzum pa'i bsam pas bzhin gyis song por smra ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig tshod 'dzin cing 'dzum pa'i bsam pas bzhin gyis song por smra ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression speaking pleasantly with a smiling face and a controlled manner of speech

original: rab tu dga' bar byed pa mnyam par ston te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar byed pa mnyam par ston te /
translated: teaches the equality of gladdening.

original: sems dang bas rab tu dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang bas rab tu dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of gladdening with a joyful mind.

original: khur blangs pa rnam mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni grogs su gyur pa mnyam par ston te /
analyzed: khur blangs pa rnam mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni grogs su gyur pa mnyam par ston te /
translated: The expression not abandoning the burden teaches the equality of being a companion.

original: khur ji ltar blangs pa mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khur ji ltar blangs pa mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not abandoning the burden as it has been taken up.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po yongs su ma bcad pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje mnyam par ston to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po yongs su ma bcad pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje mnyam par ston to //
translated: The expression not interrupting great compassion for all beings teaches the equality of compassion.

original: phyogs su ltung bas khur blangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: phyogs su ltung bas khur blangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because of taking up the burden through falling into partiality.
