translated: KaSyapa, it is thus: Just as one protected by the power of mantra and medicine cannot be harmed by poison, so, KaSyapa, the poison of the afflictions cannot overpower a bodhisattva who is protected by the power of wisdom and means.

original: nus so zhes bya ba dpe bco brgyad pa dang / 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na grong khyer chen po'i lud de ni bu ram shing gi zhing dag dang / rgyan gyi zhing dag las phan par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: nus so zhes bya ba dpe bco brgyad pa dang / 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na grong khyer chen po'i lud de ni bu ram shing gi zhing dag dang / rgyan gyi zhing dag las phan par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: KaSyapa, it is thus: Just as the manure of a great city is beneficial for sugarcane fields and vine fields,üîΩ so, KaSyapa, the manure of the afflictions of a bodhisattva is beneficial for omniscience.

original: de bzhin du 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa'i lud kyang thams cad mkhyen pa la phan par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba dpe bcu dgu pas byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa ma zad kyang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par duüîΩ'phags par ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa'i lud kyang thams cad mkhyen pa la phan par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba dpe bcu dgu pas byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa ma zad kyang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par duüîΩ'phags par ston to //
translated: By these eighteen similes, it is shown that even though the afflictions of a bodhisattva are not exhausted, he is superior to sravakas, etc.

original: de'i nyon mongs pa nyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / yon tan chen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nyon mongs pa nyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / yon tan chen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not defiled by the faults of the afflictions and because it performs the great benefit of virtue.

original: dpe 'di rnams kyi go rims ni snga ma las phyi ma bye brag tu rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe 'di rnams kyi go rims ni snga ma las phyi ma bye brag tu rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The order of these examples should be understood as a progression from the lesser to the greater.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag tu sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par sgrub pa'i @226a * //
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag tu sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par sgrub pa'i @226a * //
translated: It is said: From the time of first generating the mind of enlightenment, the bodhisattva is the basis for the accomplishment of the roots of virtue of all sentient beings in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: gnas su gyur pas phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa thams cad kyis sems ma zin pa'i phyir sems dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas su gyur pas phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa thams cad kyis sems ma zin pa'i phyir sems dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: He is like the mind because he is not seized by the mind of all those who benefit or harm him.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar yal bar 'jog pa'i sa la brten nas sems can rnams rang gi rtsal gyis de la nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar yal bar 'jog pa'i sa la brten nas sems can rnams rang gi rtsal gyis de la nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like the earth that is the basis for the sustenance of sentient beings by their own power, since it is indifferent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir dad pa dang dga' bar byed pa'i rlan gyis brlan par byed pas chu dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir dad pa dang dga' bar byed pa'i rlan gyis brlan par byed pas chu dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like water, because he is moistened with the moisture of faith and joy, in order to produce the roots of virtue.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chus lo tog yongs su smin par byed pa dang 'gal ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chus lo tog yongs su smin par byed pa dang 'gal ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like water, which is contrary to the ripening of the crop.

original: de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i chos rnams la skyobs kun du gdung bar byed pas me dang mtshungs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i chos rnams la skyobs kun du gdung bar byed pas me dang mtshungs pa yang yin no //
translated: He is like fire, because he burns up the afflictions of those who are to be trained, with the fire of his wisdom.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar me sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par sgrub pa dang 'gal ba lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar me sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par sgrub pa dang 'gal ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like fire, which is contrary to the establishment of the buddha-field.

original: de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol ba la reg par bya ba mngon par bsgrubs pa rnam par sgrub pa dang / yang dag pa'i gdams ngag nye bar sgrub pas rlung dang mtshungs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol ba la reg par bya ba mngon par bsgrubs pa rnam par sgrub pa dang / yang dag pa'i gdams ngag nye bar sgrub pas rlung dang mtshungs pa yang yin no //
translated: It is like the wind in that it accomplishes the attainment of the touch of liberation for those whose roots of virtue are mature, and it accomplishes the attainment of right instruction.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar rlung mngon par langs nas med par gyur ba de lta bu ni ma yin no de ni rang gi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir zla ba lta bu yang yin no //üîΩde lta mod kyi ji ltar zla ba yar gyi ngo la snang la /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar rlung mngon par langs nas med par gyur ba de lta bu ni ma yin no de ni rang gi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir zla ba lta bu yang yin no // de lta mod kyi ji ltar zla ba yar gyi ngo la snang la /
translated: But it is not like the wind in that it does not disappear after rising. It is like the moon in that it increases its own virtuous qualities.

original: mar gyi ngo la mi snang ba lta bu ma yin te ;
analyzed: mar gyi ngo la mi snang ba lta bu ma yin te ;
translated: But it is not like the moon in that it does not wax and wane.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad la ye shes snang bar byed pas nyi ma dang mtshungs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad la ye shes snang bar byed pas nyi ma dang mtshungs pa yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like the sun in that it illuminates all things, both virtuous and nonvirtuous, by means of its universal characteristics.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar nyi ma gza' spyang kis 'jigs pas yongs su 'gyur ba lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar nyi ma gza' spyang kis 'jigs pas yongs su 'gyur ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like the sun, which changes due to being eclipsed by RƒÅhu.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni 'gro ba rnams su nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gzas 'jigs pa'i 'gyur ba med pas seng ge lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni 'gro ba rnams su nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gzas 'jigs pa'i 'gyur ba med pas seng ge lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like a lion, because he is not changed by any of the afflictions that afflict the world.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar seng ge bur chen pos 'tsher ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar seng ge bur chen pos 'tsher ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: But he is not like a lion, who is frightened by a great noise.

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi khur thams cad khyer ba'i phyir glang po dul ba lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi khur thams cad khyer ba'i phyir glang po dul ba lta bu yang yin no //
translated: He is like a well-trained elephant, because he bears the burden of all beings.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar glang po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang ; tshig 'jam pa dang rtsub pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal spong bas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas gos pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar glang po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang ; tshig 'jam pa dang rtsub pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal spong bas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas gos pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: But he is not like an elephant, who is stained by attachment and aversion, seeking pleasure and pain, gain and loss, and pleasant and unpleasant words.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir padma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir padma lta bu yin no //
translated: That bodhisattva is like a lotus, because he is not soiled by any attachment or aversion to any worldly thing.

original: de lta mod kyi @226b ji ltar pad ma sdong bu bcad na mi skye ba lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi @226b ji ltar pad ma sdong bu bcad na mi skye ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: However, he is not like a lotus whose stalk has been cut, which does not grow again.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa bcad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas 'khor bar yang skye ba'i phyir rtsa ba nyams pa'i shing lta bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa bcad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas 'khor bar yang skye ba'i phyir rtsa ba nyams pa'i shing lta bu yang ma yin no //
translated: That bodhisattva, though he has cut off the defilements, is not like a tree whose roots have been destroyed, because he is reborn in the life-cycle through the power of his roots of virtue.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar shing tha mar rtsa ba 'jig pa lta bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar shing tha mar rtsa ba 'jig pa lta bu yang ma yin no //
translated: However, he is not like a tree whose roots are destroyed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub chen por dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir chu bo'i rgyun rgya mtshor bab pa lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub chen por dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir chu bo'i rgyun rgya mtshor bab pa lta bu yang yin no //
translated: That bodhisattva is like a river flowing into the ocean, because he is constantly bringing about the roots of virtue for nirvana and for great enlightenment.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun rgya mtshor bab na rgya mtsho nyid 'gyur ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun rgya mtshor bab na rgya mtsho nyid 'gyur ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like the flow of a river which, when it reaches the ocean, becomes the ocean itself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub chen po la brten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par rtsen pa'i phyir ri rab la lta gnas pa lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub chen po la brten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par rtsen pa'i phyir ri rab la lta gnas pa lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like one who dwells on Mount Meru, because he plays with the roots of virtue that are based on nirvana and great enlightenment.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar ri rab la gnas pa'i lha dag rang gi bya ba la bag med par dga' ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar ri rab la gnas pa'i lha dag rang gi bya ba la bag med par dga' ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like the gods who dwell on Mount Meru, who are heedless in their own activities and enjoy themselves.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like a king who is supported by his ministers, because he accomplishes all the activities of the buddhas through his possession of both means and wisdom.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po rang gi don du skye dgu yongs su skyong ba lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po rang gi don du skye dgu yongs su skyong ba lta bu ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not like a king who is supported by his ministers and who protects living beings for his own sake.

original: de ni rang gi don la mi lta bar skye dgu'i phyir rin po che lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang gi don la mi lta bar skye dgu'i phyir rin po che lta bu yang yin no //
translated: It is like a jewel for beings, not looking to its own benefit.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar sprin chen po lo tog yongs su sgrub pa gcig tu ma nges pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar sprin chen po lo tog yongs su sgrub pa gcig tu ma nges pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like a great cloud, which is not certain to produce a crop.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos shin tu bskrun pa'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos shin tu bskrun pa'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba lta bu yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is like a universal monarch, because he produces the factors of enlightenment.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba skyes bu chen po dag dang zla med pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba skyes bu chen po dag dang zla med pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: But he is not like a universal monarch, who has no rival among great men.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni rnam par grol ba thun mong ba du ma dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir nor bu rin po che k'ar sh'a pa na dang shin tu mi 'dra ba lta bu ni yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni rnam par grol ba thun mong ba du ma dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir nor bu rin po che k'ar sh'a pa na dang shin tu mi 'dra ba lta bu ni yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is like a precious jewel, which is not at all like a kar·π£a-pana coin, because he is born together with many common liberations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su chud kyang de dag dang bya ba dang / bde ba'i longs spyod mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa'i lha lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su chud kyang de dag dang bya ba dang / bde ba'i longs spyod mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa'i lha lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like the gods who enter the forest of blended trees, because he enters the uncontaminated realm, and because he shares the same activities and enjoyments of happiness with them.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa'i lha rnams nyon mongs pa 'phel nas ma 'ongs pa na log par ltung ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa'i lha rnams nyon mongs pa 'phel nas ma 'ongs pa na log par ltung ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like the gods who enter the forest of blended trees, because their afflictions increase and they will fall in the future.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa bcad nas log par mi ltung ba'i phyir dug bstsal ba lta bu'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa bcad nas log par mi ltung ba'i phyir dug bstsal ba lta bu'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like the one who has removed the poison, because he has eliminated the afflictions and does not fall.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar dug bstsal na @227a * //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar dug bstsal na @227a * //
translated: However, it is not like the one who has removed the poison,

original: gnod pa med pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa tsam du zad de /
translated: because he is only without harm,

original: su la yang yon tan du mi 'gyur ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: su la yang yon tan du mi 'gyur ba lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: but does not become virtuous for anyone.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni rang gi nyon mongs pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir grong khyer chen po'i lud lta bu'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni rang gi nyon mongs pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir grong khyer chen po'i lud lta bu'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also like the manure of a great city, because his afflictions benefit all sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten grags pa'i dngos po lta bu'i yon tan gyi dpe dang / yon tan gyis khyad par du 'phags pas yon tan 'dra ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten grags pa'i dngos po lta bu'i yon tan gyi dpe dang / yon tan gyis khyad par du 'phags pas yon tan 'dra ba med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is like a thing renowned in the world, because of his qualities. He is unequaled because of the excellence of his qualities.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'dra ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'dra ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva should be known as unequaled because of his qualities.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / yon tan gyi khyad par bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / yon tan gyi khyad par bshad zin to //
translated: The divisions of correct practice and the explanation of its excellence have been completed.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa rang bzhin ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa rang bzhin ni ma bshad do //
translated: The nature of correct practice has not been explained.

original: de ni dbu ma'i lam gyis ston te /
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i lam gyis ston te /
translated: It is taught by the middle way.

original: mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pas dbu ma'i lam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pas dbu ma'i lam du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the middle way because it abandons the two extremes.

original: mtha' gang zhe na mu stegs can gyi mtha' ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / de la rtag par 'dzin pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la sgro btags te /
analyzed: mtha' gang zhe na mu stegs can gyi mtha' ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / de la rtag par 'dzin pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la sgro btags te /
translated: What are the extremes? The extreme of the tƒ´rthikas is the grasping of a self and the grasping of that self as permanent, which is the superimposition of a self on the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de ni gang 'og nas mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: de ni gang 'og nas mdor bsdus te /
translated: That is what is referred to later in the text in the passage:

original: rtag ces bya ba de ni mtha' gcig go bdag ces bya ba de ni mtha' gcig go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtag ces bya ba de ni mtha' gcig go bdag ces bya ba de ni mtha' gcig go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúPermanence‚Äù is one extreme; ‚Äúself‚Äù is one extreme.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can gyi mtha' ni gang phung po la sogs pa la mi rtag par 'dzin pa dang / bdag med par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can gyi mtha' ni gang phung po la sogs pa la mi rtag par 'dzin pa dang / bdag med par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The extreme of those in the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna and PratyekabuddhayƒÅna is the grasping of the aggregates and so on as impermanent and the grasping of them as lacking a self.

original: de yang gang 'og nas mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: de yang gang 'og nas mdor bsdus te /
translated: That is what is referred to later in the text in the passage:

original: mi rtag ces bya ba de ni mtha' gnyis bdag med ces bya ba de ni mtha' gnyis zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba de ni mtha' gnyis bdag med ces bya ba de ni mtha' gnyis zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúImpermanence‚Äù is one extreme; ‚Äúlack of self‚Äù is one extreme.üîΩThe middle that is the center between those two extremes is the middle way that is correct seeing of reality.

original: mtha' de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: That is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de rnam par brtag tu med pas dpyad du med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par brtag tu med pas dpyad du med pa'o //
translated: Since it cannot be conceptualized, it cannot be analyzed.

original: brjod du med cing bshad du med pas bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med cing bshad du med pas bstan du med pa'o //
translated: It is imperceptible because it is inexpressible and cannot be explained.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas ma yin pas rten ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas ma yin pas rten ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a basis because it is not a location for consciousness.

original: gzung ba'i don du gzung ba med pas snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i don du gzung ba med pas snang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is non-apparent because it cannot be apprehended as an object of perception.

original: 'dzin pa'i don rnam par rig pa tsam du gzung du med pas rnam par rig par med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don rnam par rig pa tsam du gzung du med pas rnam par rig par med pa'o //
translated: It is non-cognizable because it cannot be apprehended as the mere representation of the object of perception.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pas gnas med par rig par bya'o //

original: stong ba zhes bya ba ni med pa la chos su 'dzin pa gzhig pa'i phyir zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: stong ba zhes bya ba ni med pa la chos su 'dzin pa gzhig pa'i phyir zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: The term emptiness is taught in order to destroy the apprehension of non-existence as a phenomenon.

original: kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang stong na chos thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang stong na chos thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: If emptiness itself is empty of the imaginary nature, what need is there to mention all phenomena?

original: kun du brtags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin med pa 'dzin pa bkag @229a * //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin med pa 'dzin pa bkag @229a * //
translated: The apprehension of the non-existence of the imaginary nature of phenomena is refuted.

original: go ; de ltar na kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: go ; de ltar na kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the imaginary nature does not exist, emptiness also does not exist.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the perfected nature does not not exist.

original: stong pa nyid ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as with emptiness, so it is with all phenomena.

original: chos med pa la 'dzin pa bkag pas ni chos kyi rang bzhin med par ston to //
analyzed: chos med pa la 'dzin pa bkag pas ni chos kyi rang bzhin med par ston to //
translated: The apprehension of the non-existence of phenomena is refuted, demonstrating that the nature of phenomena does not exist.üîΩ In order to demonstrate that the perfected nature of that emptiness exists, it is said:üîΩThe past is empty.

original: stong pa nyid de'i yongs su grub pa de yod par bstan pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' stong zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de'i yongs su grub pa de yod par bstan pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' stong zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: The past is empty of the past.

original: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dus na dus thams cad du de bzhin du yod par yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dus na dus thams cad du de bzhin du yod par yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is shown to exist in the same way at all times, in the states of ordinary men, of those in training, and of the adepts.

original: stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'brang bar bya zhes bya ba ni don gyi phyir 'brang pas stong pa nyid kyi don rab tu rtogs pa'i thabs ston to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'brang bar bya zhes bya ba ni don gyi phyir 'brang pas stong pa nyid kyi don rab tu rtogs pa'i thabs ston to //
translated: Because of emptiness, one should follow the letter means that one should follow the meaning, and not the letter, in order to understand the meaning of emptiness.

original: gang zag lam yin zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag lam yin zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The person is the path means the opposite of following the letter.

original: de'i phyir 'brangs na yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brangs na yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, one should follow the person means that one should follow the letter.

original: gang zag tu btags pa gang yin pa dang / gang la 'dogs pa de gnyi ga la yang gang zag ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag tu btags pa gang yin pa dang / gang la 'dogs pa de gnyi ga la yang gang zag ces gsungs so //
translated: The person is said to be the designation, and that to which it is designated is also said to be the person.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid la dmigs zhes bya ba ci ston zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid la dmigs zhes bya ba ci ston zhe na /
translated: What does it mean to say those who take emptiness as a basis?

original: kun du brtags pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la dmigs pas stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'brang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la dmigs pas stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'brang bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not follow the letter, because of emptiness, when emptiness is taken as a basis, as the emptiness of the imagined nature.

original: de ltar 'brangs na sngar ni gang zag tu 'dzin pas nyams la phyis ni chos su 'dzin pas nyams te /
analyzed: de ltar 'brangs na sngar ni gang zag tu 'dzin pas nyams la phyis ni chos su 'dzin pas nyams te /
translated: If one follows that, one is first ruined by the personal self-habit, and later by the objective self-habit.

original: shin tu ma rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu ma rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a very bad thing.

original: de byas na shin tu ma rung bar 'gyur ba rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de byas na shin tu ma rung bar 'gyur ba rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: To establish that it is a very bad thing,

original: 'od srungs ri rab tsam gang zag la lta bar gnas pa bla zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs ri rab tsam gang zag la lta bar gnas pa bla zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, it is better to abide in the view of the person as being the size of Mount Meru than for a view of emptiness to arise from grasping at signs.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pas ni /
translated: Because of observing emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid yongs su mi shes la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yongs su mi shes la /
translated: one does not understand emptiness.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis don dam par khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis don dam par khong du mi chud do //
translated: Because of pride, one does not comprehend the ultimate.

original: khong du ma chud na skur pa 'debs so //
analyzed: khong du ma chud na skur pa 'debs so //
translated: Because of not comprehending, one deprecates.

original: de bas na gang zag tu lta ba bor yang gsor mi rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na gang zag tu lta ba bor yang gsor mi rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even if one abandons the view of the person, one is incurable.

original: dper na sman gyis nad kyi nyes pa bskyod de /
analyzed: dper na sman gyis nad kyi nyes pa bskyod de /
translated: For example, it is like the case of medicine that stirs up the faults of a disease,

original: ltor song ba zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ltor song ba zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: and then goes into the stomach.

original: de lta bu las byung ba ni stong pa nyid na zhes bya ba kun du brtags pa de'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu las byung ba ni stong pa nyid na zhes bya ba kun du brtags pa de'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'am /
translated: That is what is meant by ‚Äúarising from that‚Äù in the statement, ‚ÄúThe view of emptiness arises from grasping at signs.‚Äù

original: thams cad thams cad med pa tsam du mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad med pa tsam du mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that one should not cling to the idea that everything is just a non-existence of everything.

original: nam mkha'i dpe ni 'gyur ba med pa la 'dzin pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dpe ni 'gyur ba med pa la 'dzin pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir te /
translated: The example of space is given in order to eliminate the grasping at the immutability of emptiness.

original: su stong pa nyid du lta ba de stong pa nyid des gzugs la sogs pa med par 'dod pa na med pa la rtog ste /
analyzed: su stong pa nyid du lta ba de stong pa nyid des gzugs la sogs pa med par 'dod pa na med pa la rtog ste /
translated: If one who views emptiness as an entity were to assert that form and so on do not exist because of emptiness, then one would be conceiving of non-existence.

original: de ni de'i 'gyur ba med pa la 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'gyur ba med pa la 'dzin pa'o //
translated: That is the grasping at the immutability of emptiness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni rang bzhin gyis med na nam mkha' sel bar 'dod pa dang 'dra bar @229b sems can dag ni chos nyid kyis stong pa nyid la spyod na yod par yongs su rtog nas de nyid kyis mi skrag go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni rang bzhin gyis med na nam mkha' sel bar 'dod pa dang 'dra bar @229b sems can dag ni chos nyid kyis stong pa nyid la spyod na yod par yongs su rtog nas de nyid kyis mi skrag go //
translated: If form and so on were non-existent by nature, then just as one would assert that space is an exclusion, sentient beings would conceive of the emptiness of reality as an existent and would not be afraid of it.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa med du zin na rtsom pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ri mo mkhan gyi dpe bstan te /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa med du zin na rtsom pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ri mo mkhan gyi dpe bstan te /
translated: In order to eliminate the fault that would be entailed by the uselessness of effort if form and so on did not exist, the example of the painter is taught.

original: dper na gnod sbyin yod pa ma yin na ri mo mkhan gyi rang gi rnam par rtog pas khas bub du 'gyel ba de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa la byis pa rnams rang gi rnam par rtog pa log pas 'khor bar 'khyam
analyzed: dper na gnod sbyin yod pa ma yin na ri mo mkhan gyi rang gi rnam par rtog pas khas bub du 'gyel ba de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa la byis pa rnams rang gi rnam par rtog pa log pas 'khor bar 'khyam
translated: For example, when there is no yak·π£a, a painter falls face down on the ground by his own imagination. In the same way, fools wander in cyclic existence by their own wrong imagination, because of the non-existence of form, etc.

original: ste / mi shes pa de dang 'bral ba'i phyir rtsom pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ste / mi shes pa de dang 'bral ba'i phyir rtsom pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that their undertaking is pointless, because they are separated from that ignorance.

original: gong mas ni log pa bkag go //
analyzed: gong mas ni log pa bkag go //
translated: The previous verse refutes the wrong view.

original: 'di ni rtsom pa don med pa dgag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsom pa don med pa dgag par rig par bya'o //
translated: This verse should be understood as refuting the pointlessness of undertaking.

original: gal te 'di dag ni sems kyi nor pa tsam du ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid yongs su shes zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir sgyu ma mkhan gyi dpe bstan to //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag ni sems kyi nor pa tsam du ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid yongs su shes zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir sgyu ma mkhan gyi dpe bstan to //
translated: If you argue, ‚ÄúSince these are just errors of mind, how can that very mind fully understand that very mind?,‚Äù the example of the magician is taught in order to abandon that objection.

original: de la sgyu ma mkhan lta bu ni yid la byed pa tsam gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgyu ma mkhan lta bu ni yid la byed pa tsam gyi shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, the magician is consciousness that is just mental activity.

original: sprul pa lta bu ni don med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu ni don med par shes par bya'o //
translated: The conjured person should be understood as unreal objects.

original: za ba lta bu ni yid la byed pa tsam yang med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: za ba lta bu ni yid la byed pa tsam yang med par shes pa ste /
translated: Eating is the mere consciousness without any mental activity.

original: gsog la sogs par snang ngo //
analyzed: gsog la sogs par snang ngo //
translated: It appears as if it were accumulating.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba med na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma mthong bas ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes skyes zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba med na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma mthong bas ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes skyes zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: If the noble faculty of wisdom does not see reality as it is, then, since it does not see reality as it is, how can supramundane wisdom arise?

original: shing gnyis kyi dpes bstan te /
analyzed: shing gnyis kyi dpes bstan te /
translated: This is illustrated by the example of the two sticks.

original: shing gnyis lta bu ni tshul bzhin so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: shing gnyis lta bu ni tshul bzhin so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The two sticks are the discernment of reality.

original: gtsubs pa las me 'byung ba lta bu ni /
analyzed: gtsubs pa las me 'byung ba lta bu ni /
translated: The arising of the fire is

original: shes rab kyi dbang po 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po 'byung ba ste /
translated: the arising of the faculty of wisdom.

original: byung nas tshul bzhin so sor rtog pa de yang spong bar ston to //üîΩci ye shes skyes pa 'am /
analyzed: byung nas tshul bzhin so sor rtog pa de yang spong bar ston to // ci ye shes skyes pa 'am /
translated: Having arisen, it abandons the discernment of reality.

original: 'on te ma skyes pa mi shes pa'i gnyen por 'gyur zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa mi shes pa'i gnyen por 'gyur zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Does wisdom arise or not arise as the antidote to ignorance?

original: mar me'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: mar me'i dpe bstan te /
translated: This is illustrated by the example of the lamp.

original: ye shes byed pa med kyang /
analyzed: ye shes byed pa med kyang /
translated: Wisdom does not arise,

original: skyes ma thag tu mi shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu mi shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ston to //
translated: The second half of the verse shows the remedy for the ignorance that arises immediately upon birth.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ji ltar thog ma yod pa'i dus kyi gnyan pos spong zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ji ltar thog ma yod pa'i dus kyi gnyan pos spong zhes rgol ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to avoid the objection, ‚ÄúHow can the defilement of beginningless time be eliminated by a remedy that has a beginning in time?,‚Äù

original: mar me'i dpe gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: mar me'i dpe gnyis bstan te /
translated: two fire-examples are taught.

original: dbu ma'i lam mdor bstan to //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam mdor bstan to //
translated: The middle path is briefly taught.

original: rgya cher rnam par dbye ste /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par dbye ste /
translated: It is extensively distinguished.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya'o //
translated: The arrangement of the training of the bodhisattva who abides in correct practice should be understood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos la gnas pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul du bshad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa'i tshul ston pa dang / @230a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos la gnas pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul du bshad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa'i tshul ston pa dang / @230a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the Dharma does not grasp the literal meaning of the teaching of the method of the two truths, which is explained in the method of the conventional truth,

original: drang ba'i don la sgra ji bzhin du mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: drang ba'i don la sgra ji bzhin du mi 'dzin te /
translated: and does not grasp the literal meaning of the interpretable meaning.

original: rgyu de gnyis kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i mdo sde'i phyir mi 'brang ste /
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i mdo sde'i phyir mi 'brang ste /
translated: By these two causes, he does not follow the s≈´tras that are connected with the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: 'das nas de la sbyang mkhas par bya ste /
analyzed: 'das nas de la sbyang mkhas par bya ste /
translated: Having passed beyond that, he should become skilled in the training.

original: de las theg pa chen po dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos zab mo stong pa nyid dang rab tu ldan par rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa'i tshul bsdus pa'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul bstan pa'i chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig tu ston pas nges pa'i don gyi gzhir gyur mkhas par gyur te /
analyzed: de las theg pa chen po dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos zab mo stong pa nyid dang rab tu ldan par rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa'i tshul bsdus pa'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul bstan pa'i chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig tu ston pas nges pa'i don gyi gzhir gyur mkhas par gyur te /
translated: Because of that, he became skilled in the way of the ultimate, the realm of phenomena, which teaches the way of the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate, in order to include the way of the truths, which is both established and not established, and which is endowed with the profound emptiness that is endowed with the Great Vehicle.

original: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir 'brang bar sbyor bas tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir 'brang bar sbyor bas tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, he is called ‚Äúone who is properly engaged through following.‚Äù

analyzed: tshul bzhin du sbyor bas dbu ma'i lam du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Because he is properly engaged, he has entered the middle path.

original: 'di ltar dbu ma'i lam ni rnam pa bcu gsum du ston te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbu ma'i lam ni rnam pa bcu gsum du ston te /
translated: The middle path is taught in thirteen aspects.

original: gang zag stong pa nyid du ston pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos stong pa nyid dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / chos mngon par rtogs pa dang ;
analyzed: gang zag stong pa nyid du ston pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos stong pa nyid dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / chos mngon par rtogs pa dang ;
translated: the teaching of the emptiness of the person, the selflessness of the person, the emptiness of things, the selflessness of things, the extreme of superimposition, the extreme of denial, the realization of the Dharma,

original: de yang byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang / de ltar zhugs pa nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gnyis kyis sems ma zin pa dang / bdag med pa gnyi ga la mos pa'i khyad par dang / bdag med pa snga ma bdag med pa phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pa dang /
analyzed: de yang byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang / de ltar zhugs pa nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gnyis kyis sems ma zin pa dang / bdag med pa gnyi ga la mos pa'i khyad par dang / bdag med pa snga ma bdag med pa phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pa dang /
translated: the dedication of merit to great enlightenment, the non-abandonment of samsara by one who has entered the path, the non-seizure of mind by the two, afflictions and suffering, the distinction of the resolve for the two selflessnesses, the prior selflessness as the cause of the subsequent selflessness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa dang / de nyid kyi mthu ston pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa dang / de nyid kyi mthu ston pa'o //
translated: the culmination of emptiness, and the demonstration of its power.

original: de la ji ltar gang zag stong pa nyid du ston ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gang zag stong pa nyid du ston ce na /
translated: How does he teach the emptiness of the person?

original: rnam pa gcig gis mi dmigs par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis mi dmigs par yongs su ston te /
translated: He teaches it by way of non-apprehension of one kind:

original: gang zag la bdag med par so sor rtog ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par so sor rtog ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, ‚ÄúHe discerns the selflessness of the person.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi dngos po phung po rnams dang / de'i sna tshogs kyi dngos po khams dang / de'i longs spyod kyi dngos po skye mched rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gyi dngos po phung po rnams dang / de'i sna tshogs kyi dngos po khams dang / de'i longs spyod kyi dngos po skye mched rnams te /
translated: The three kinds of things are the things that are aggregates of sentient beings, the things that are the various elements of those sentient beings, and the things that are the sense-spheres which are the enjoyments of those sentient beings.

original: dngos po rnam pa gsum la bdag mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa gsum la bdag mi dmigs te /
translated: The self is not perceived in any of these three kinds of things.üîΩThe self that is imagined by the foolish is not perceived either internally, externally, or somewhere in between.

original: nang dang phyi dang gnyi ga med pa'i bar nas kyang byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag mi dmigs so zhes mi dmigs par yongs su ston pas gang zag stong pa nyid du yongs su ston to //
analyzed: nang dang phyi dang gnyi ga med pa'i bar nas kyang byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag mi dmigs so zhes mi dmigs par yongs su ston pas gang zag stong pa nyid du yongs su ston to //
translated: In this way, by teaching non-perception, he teaches the emptiness of the individual.

original: ji ltar gang zag la bdag med par ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag la bdag med par ston ce na /
translated: How does he teach the selflessness of the person?

original: rnam pa gcig gis dmigs pa yongs su ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis dmigs pa yongs su ston te /
translated: He teaches the non-perception of the object of the view of the self in one way.

original: de la dmigs pa 'di ni rtag par yang mi rtog ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa 'di ni rtag par yang mi rtog ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe object of the view of the self is not perceived as permanent.‚Äù

original: dngos po gsum po byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid la rtag par mi dmigs pa'i phyir byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag dang @230b mi 'dra bas phung po rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid dmigs so zhes bdag med pa'i
analyzed: dngos po gsum po byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid la rtag par mi dmigs pa'i phyir byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag dang @230b mi 'dra bas phung po rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid dmigs so zhes bdag med pa'i
translated: The three things are not perceived in that very dependent origination imagined by the childish, because they are unlike the self imagined by the childish. Therefore, the impermanence of the aggregates is perceived.

original: rang bzhin yongs su brjod pas dngos po la gnas pa'i gang zag la bdag med par ston to //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su brjod pas dngos po la gnas pa'i gang zag la bdag med par ston to //
translated: Thus, by describing the nature of selflessness, he teaches the selflessness of the person who abides in things.

original: ji ltar chos stong pa nyid du ston ce na /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
