original: lta bar song ba thams cad las byung ba ni stong pa nyid na gang stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes nga mi 'chad do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis don 'di bstan te //
analyzed: lta bar song ba thams cad las byung ba ni stong pa nyid na gang stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes nga mi 'chad do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis don 'di bstan te //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúI do not explain that one who views emptiness as emptiness is incurable‚Äù shows this point.

original: gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam bla zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu lta ba gnyen po dang bcas pa'i phyir spong nus par ston to //
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam bla zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu lta ba gnyen po dang bcas pa'i phyir spong nus par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is better to have the view of a self the size of Mount Meru‚Äù shows that it is possible to eliminate the view of a self because the view of a self can be countered.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa mthong bas bdag gi stong pa nyid kyis 'du byed rnams stong par mthong ngo snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du rig
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa mthong bas bdag gi stong pa nyid kyis 'du byed rnams stong par mthong ngo snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du rig
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe view of emptiness is not a view for one who is proud‚Äù shows that one who is proud because of seeing selflessness in phenomena thinks, ‚ÄúI see that the emptiness of the self is the emptiness of all phenomena.‚Äù

original: par bya'o // kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyang stong na brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid la stong ngo zhes kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa ni phyin ci log tu rab tu gnas te /
analyzed: par bya'o // kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyang stong na brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid la stong ngo zhes kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa ni phyin ci log tu rab tu gnas te /
translated: The error of deprecation is to suppose that emptiness is not the imagined nature.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i lta bas stong pa nyid du lta ba ma yin no //üîΩgang stong pa nyid du lta ba ma yin pas gsor mi rung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i lta bas stong pa nyid du lta ba ma yin no // gang stong pa nyid du lta ba ma yin pas gsor mi rung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One who does not see emptiness does not see the truth.üîΩOne who does not see the truth is not liberated from birth, etc.

original: gsor mi rung ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su mi grol lo //
analyzed: gsor mi rung ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su mi grol lo //
translated: One who is not liberated from birth, etc. does not transcend suffering.

original: @234a * // dus thams cad du nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang gnas te /
analyzed: @234a * // dus thams cad du nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang gnas te /
translated: One who does not transcend suffering is not liberated from the burning of the afflictions at all times and abides in suffering.

original: nad pa gsor mi rung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nad pa gsor mi rung ba bzhin no //
translated: He is like a patient who cannot be cured.

original: sngon dang phyi mar rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par 'jig pa ni rgyu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mar rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par 'jig pa ni rgyu gnyis pa ste /
translated: Destruction in two ways, in the past and in the future, is the second cause.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu nad pa da la sman pa des sman byin na zhes bya ba'i dpe 'dis ston to //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu nad pa da la sman pa des sman byin na zhes bya ba'i dpe 'dis ston to //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this: for example, this is shown by the example of a sick person to whom a doctor gives medicine.

original: de 'di lta ste dper na nad pas chos bzhin legs par ma byas pas nyes par spyod pas nad rnams mi 'byung ba dang / nad dang ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir snga phyi tshor ba rnam pa gnyis myong ba de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med par lta ba la rab tu spyod kyang bdag tu lta ba ma spangs pas stong pa nyid la chos kyi bdag tu 'dzin pa
analyzed: de 'di lta ste dper na nad pas chos bzhin legs par ma byas pas nyes par spyod pas nad rnams mi 'byung ba dang / nad dang ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir snga phyi tshor ba rnam pa gnyis myong ba de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med par lta ba la rab tu spyod kyang bdag tu lta ba ma spangs pas stong pa nyid la chos kyi bdag tu 'dzin pa
translated: Just as a sick person, because of not properly doing what the doctor prescribed, does not recover from his illness, and because of the cause of having an illness, experiences two kinds of feelings, earlier and later, in the same way, although one practices the view of the nonexistence of a self in the person, because one has not abandoned the view of a self, the grasping of a self in phenomena arises from emptiness.

original: 'byung bas nyon mongs pa'i nad dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'byung bas nyon mongs pa'i nad dang ldan te /
translated: Thus one has the illness of the afflictions.

original: snga phyi 'dzin pa gnyis kyis rnam par 'jig pas rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga phyi 'dzin pa gnyis kyis rnam par 'jig pas rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the two kinds of grasping, earlier and later, one is destroyed and falls away.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas, on the other hand, are not like that.

original: 'di ni thag ring po dma' ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di ni thag ring po dma' ba'i bye brag go //
translated: This is the difference in their distance and inferiority.

original: de la spong ba rnam par 'khrul ba'i bye brag 'di ni /
analyzed: de la spong ba rnam par 'khrul ba'i bye brag 'di ni /
translated: The specific error of rejection is as follows:

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig nam mkhas 'jigs skrag ces rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig nam mkhas 'jigs skrag ces rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
translated: KaSyapa, it is like this: for example, some person, frightened by space, would say, Remove this space!

original: dper na la la zhig rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i nam mkha' la 'ga' zhig tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na la la zhig rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i nam mkha' la 'ga' zhig tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: For example, someone, on the basis of his own conceptual thought, imputes something in space.

original: sgro btags nas des 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: sgro btags nas des 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: Having imputed, he is frightened by it, and says, Remove this space!

original: nam mkha' 'di sol zhes zer ba de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas la chos la bdag med pa nyid tu mngon par zhen nas skrag ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' 'di sol zhes zer ba de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas la chos la bdag med pa nyid tu mngon par zhen nas skrag ste /
translated: In the same way, someone, who is established in the selflessness of the person, but who is attached to the selflessness of things, is frightened, and says, Remove this space-like inexpressible thing!

original: nam mkha' lta bur brjod du med pa'i dngos po las med pa las kun du brtags nas gzugs la sogs par sgro 'dogs so sgro btags nas bsam gtan pa'i mgo'i thod pa bzhin du de nyid la chags par yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur brjod du med pa'i dngos po las med pa las kun du brtags nas gzugs la sogs par sgro 'dogs so sgro btags nas bsam gtan pa'i mgo'i thod pa bzhin du de nyid la chags par yongs su tshol lo //
translated: Having imputed form, etc., he seeks it, as if it were a treasure, in that very thing, which is like the skull of one who practices meditation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva, however, is not like that.

original: 'di ni spong ba rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di ni spong ba rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag go //
translated: This is the specific error of rejection.

original: de la sems rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag 'di ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The specific error of thought is as follows:

original: dper na skyes bu ri mo mkhan bdag nyid kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs 'jigs lta zhig bris na zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu ri mo mkhan bdag nyid kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs 'jigs lta zhig bris na zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: For example, a painter, a demon, or a magician, having painted a demon's form, or having conjured up a demon, is frightened by it, and falls into a swoon.

original: de bzhin du spong ba rnam par 'khrul pa gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas pa yang rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i yul rnams las 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pas phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du spong ba rnam par 'khrul pa gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas pa yang rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i yul rnams las 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pas phyin ci log ste /
translated: In the same way, the person who is situated in the selflessness of the person, but who has the error of thought, is frightened by the objects that arise from his own thoughts, and falls into a swoon through the error of discrimination, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva is not like that.

original: 'di ni sems rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sems rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: This is the specific error of thought.

original: de ltar rnam pa @234b bzhis bye brag tu ston to //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa @234b bzhis bye brag tu ston to //
translated: Thus, the specific error is shown in four ways.

original: ji ltar rgyu ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu ston ce na /
translated: How is the cause shown?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi dpe dang / shing gnyis kyi dpe dang dpe gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi dpe dang / shing gnyis kyi dpe dang dpe gnyis kyis so //
translated: By two examples: the example of the magician, and the example of the two sticks.

original: dpe dang pos ni 'dzin pa la so sor rtog pa yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: dpe dang pos ni 'dzin pa la so sor rtog pa yongs su bstan te /
translated: The first example illustrates the discernment of the apprehending subject.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes 'du byed tsam du 'dzin pa la chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis so sor rtog go //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes 'du byed tsam du 'dzin pa la chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis so sor rtog go //
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of the person discerns the mere conditioning of the apprehension of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de bas na chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes ni 'dzin pa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes ni 'dzin pa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the selflessness of dharmas is called the discernment of the apprehending subject.

original: de yod na yod pa'i phyir gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes ni chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i phyir gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes ni chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Because it exists when that exists, the knowledge of the selflessness of the person is the cause of the knowledge of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan ni sgyu ma'i sprul pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan ni sgyu ma'i sprul pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, a magician is the cause of the magical creation.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma sprul pas sgyu ma mkhan zos pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes zos so //üîΩtha snyad can gyi rang bzhin dang bral bas stong pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma sprul pas sgyu ma mkhan zos pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes zos so // tha snyad can gyi rang bzhin dang bral bas stong pa'o //
translated: Just as the magical creation eats the magician, the knowledge of the selflessness of dharmas of the yogis eats the knowledge of the selflessness of the person.üîΩIt is empty because it is devoid of the nature of conventional reality.

original: de yongs su rtog pa dang bral bas gsog go //
analyzed: de yongs su rtog pa dang bral bas gsog go //
translated: It is hollow because it is devoid of thorough discrimination.

original: spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas gsob po //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas gsob po //
translated: It is hollow, because it is characterized by what is to be abandoned.

original: skad cig pa min pas snying po med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa min pas snying po med do //
translated: It is insubstantial, because it is not momentary.

original: so sor rtog pa ni za ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni za ba lta bu'o //
translated: Discernment is like the eater.

original: dpe gnyis pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dpe gnyis pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The second example is like this.

original: yang dag par rab tu rtogs par yongs su ston to //üîΩde la 'di lta ste /üîΩyang dag par rab tu rtogs pa 'di ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las yongs su rtog pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gnyis kyis rjes su 'gro ba las /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu rtogs par yongs su ston to // de la 'di lta ste / yang dag par rab tu rtogs pa 'di ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las yongs su rtog pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gnyis kyis rjes su 'gro ba las /
translated: It shows the correct understanding.

original: so so rang gis rig pa nges pa'i ye shes skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa nges pa'i ye shes skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the correct understanding is the arising of the intuitive wisdom of individual intuitive reflex-ivity, which is the result of the two kinds of proper mental attention to the discrimination of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de la gzung ba la rtog pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la gzung ba la rtog pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: In this regard, the discrimination of the grasped is the intuitive wisdom of the selflessness of personality.

original: 'dzin pa la rtog pa ni chos la bdag med par sbyor ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la rtog pa ni chos la bdag med par sbyor ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The discrimination of the grasper is the intuitive wisdom of the selflessness of the dharmas.

original: gtsub gtan dang / gtsub shing gnyis gnyis lta bu'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de gnyis kyi yid la byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba las /
analyzed: gtsub gtan dang / gtsub shing gnyis gnyis lta bu'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de gnyis kyi yid la byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba las /
translated: The two kinds of proper mental attention to the discrimination of the grasped and the grasper are like the two things, the drill stick and the upper and lower sticks, in the example.

original: so so rang gis rig pa nges pa'i ye shes skye ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa nges pa'i ye shes skye ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the intuitive wisdom of the realization of the individual vehicle is called ‚Äúthe thorough analysis of the way things really are.‚Äù

original: shing gnyis kyi dpe 'dis ni rgyu nyid du ston to //
analyzed: shing gnyis kyi dpe 'dis ni rgyu nyid du ston to //
translated: This example of the two sticks shows the cause.

original: ji ltar shing gnyis gtsubs pa las me byung nas shing de gnyis tshig nges pa de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes la sbyor ba'i rgyu las 'byung ba chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes so so rang gis rig pa nges pa'i ye shes skyes pas sbyor ba'i ye shes gnyis po yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la yang
analyzed: ji ltar shing gnyis gtsubs pa las me byung nas shing de gnyis tshig nges pa de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes la sbyor ba'i rgyu las 'byung ba chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes so so rang gis rig pa nges pa'i ye shes skyes pas sbyor ba'i ye shes gnyis po yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la yang
translated: Just as fire arises from the rubbing together of two sticks and then burns up those two sticks, in the same way, the intuitive wisdom of the realization of the selflessness of phenomena arises from the cause of the application to the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena. The arising of the intuitive wisdom of the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, which is the individual vehicle, burns up the two applications, which are of the nature of imagination.

original: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa tshig pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa tshig pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The thorough analysis of the way things really are is like the burning.

original: de ltar de gnyis @235a * //üîΩkyis rgyu nyid tu ston to //
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis @235a * // kyis rgyu nyid tu ston to //
translated: Thus, these two show the cause.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How does it show the culmination of emptiness?

original: rnam pa gcig gis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis te /
translated: by one aspect.

original: de yang chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes ji lta ba bzhin du kun du bstan te /
analyzed: de yang chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes ji lta ba bzhin du kun du bstan te /
translated: And that is the knowledge of the selflessness of dharmas, as it is taught.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: As it is said: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na mar me phyung na mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpe 'dis so //
analyzed: dper na mar me phyung na mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpe 'dis so //
translated: For example, when a lamp is lit, all thick darkness vanishes.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba 'di ni mi shes pa dang shes pa mtshungs pas tha snyad can gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba 'di ni mi shes pa dang shes pa mtshungs pas tha snyad can gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: In that, seeing things as they really are is empty because it is free from the nature of conventional designations, since ignorance and knowledge are the same.

original: de ltar mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir gzung du med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir gzung du med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no such clinging, it is ungraspable.

original: skad cig ma'i phyir byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyir byed pa med pa ste /
translated: Since it is momentary, it is without action.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa ston to //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa ston to //
translated: Thus, the culmination of emptiness is taught.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid de'i mthu ston ce na rnam pa gcig gis te /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid de'i mthu ston ce na rnam pa gcig gis te /
translated: How does one show the power of that emptiness? By one aspect.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po yongs su bstan pas so //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po yongs su bstan pas so //
translated: By teaching the antidote that abandons karma and afflictions.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: As it is said: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na khyim mam /
analyzed: dper na khyim mam /
translated: For example, in a houseüîΩ or a room

original: khang pa 'am /
analyzed: khang pa 'am /
translated: or a small room,

original: khang phran lo brgya stong 'das par len 'ga' yang mar me ma lus pa zhes bya ba'i dpe 'dis so //
analyzed: khang phran lo brgya stong 'das par len 'ga' yang mar me ma lus pa zhes bya ba'i dpe 'dis so //
translated: this example of the lamp that has consumed all the oil shows the abandonment of the afflictions by the bodhisattva who has attained the eighth stage.

original: de la spong bas yongs su bstan pa 'di ni ye shes kyi snang ba skyes pa'i skad cig des thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: de la spong bas yongs su bstan pa 'di ni ye shes kyi snang ba skyes pa'i skad cig des thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
translated: In this regard, this teaching by way of abandonment is the abandonment of the karma and the afflictions that have been active since beginningless time by the bodhisattva who has generated the light of wisdom.

original: de ltar na stong pa nyid kyi mthun ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa nyid kyi mthun ston pa'o //
translated: Thus, it shows the power of emptiness.

original: de ltar tshul bzhin la zhugs pa ni dbu ma'i lam du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshul bzhin la zhugs pa ni dbu ma'i lam du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: One who has entered into such a practice has entered the middle way.

original: gal te de ltar nyon mongs pa myur du spong na ni ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' yun ring du 'khor zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nyon mongs pa myur du spong na ni ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' yun ring du 'khor zhe na /
translated: If the afflictions are quickly abandoned in this way, why does the bodhisattva remain in cyclic existence for a long time?

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i khyad par te /
translated: It is because of the distinction in the result.

original: dpe gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: dpe gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: This is shown by two examples.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na nam mkha' las sa bon rnams mi 'khrung ngo zhes bya ba dang / lud kyis gang ba'i sa las sa bon rnams 'khrung ngo zhes bya ba'i dpe gnyis kyis de ston to //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' las sa bon rnams mi 'khrung ngo zhes bya ba dang / lud kyis gang ba'i sa las sa bon rnams 'khrung ngo zhes bya ba'i dpe gnyis kyis de ston to //
translated: Two examples illustrate this: seeds do not grow in the sky, but they do grow in a field rich in compost.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa mya ngan las 'das kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa mya ngan las 'das kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva, although his intention is to attain nirvana,

original: sems can la lta bas sangs rgyas kyi chos thob par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su gzung bas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can la lta bas sangs rgyas kyi chos thob par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su gzung bas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: takes up samsara in order to attain the qualities of the Buddha by looking at beings and dedicates his roots of virtue.

original: yun ring bor 'khor ro //
analyzed: yun ring bor 'khor ro //
translated: He remains for a long time.

original: de lta 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: de lta 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: Thus, unconditioned nirvana is like the sky.

original: de la gnas na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi 'khrung gi snying rje'i gnas la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyon mongs pa'i lud kyis gang ba'i sems can gyi 'jig rten gnas pa lud kyis gang ba'i sa lta bu de la gnas nas byang chub sems
analyzed: de la gnas na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi 'khrung gi snying rje'i gnas la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyon mongs pa'i lud kyis gang ba'i sems can gyi 'jig rten gnas pa lud kyis gang ba'i sa lta bu de la gnas nas byang chub sems
translated: If one remains there, the qualities of the Buddha do not grow. But bodhisattvas who remain in the place of compassion, in the world of beings who are like a field rich in compost, remain in the world of beings who are like a field rich in compost.

original: dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi @235b chos rnams 'khrung ngo //
analyzed: dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi @235b chos rnams 'khrung ngo //
translated: The excellent qualities of the Buddha arise from the Bodhisattvas.

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'dus byas dma' ba'i gnas las byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dam pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'dus byas dma' ba'i gnas las byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dam pa skye zhe na /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúHow can the excellent qualities of the Buddha arise from the Bodhisattvas, who are in the lower realm of the conditioned?‚Äù

original: pad mo de'i dpes rab tu sgrub ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: pad mo de'i dpes rab tu sgrub ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: This is established by the example of the lotus.üîΩFor example, a lotus grows from the mud that is its source.

original: dper na lud yod pa'i 'dam rdzab nas pad mo 'khrung ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i lud yod pa'i 'dam rdzab log pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'khrung ngo //
analyzed: dper na lud yod pa'i 'dam rdzab nas pad mo 'khrung ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i lud yod pa'i 'dam rdzab log pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'khrung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the excellent qualities of the Buddha arise in the Bodhisattvas from the mud of sentient beings, who are in the lower realm of the conditioned.

original: smras pa / de lta na go byang chub sems dpa' rnams las nyan thos rnams kyi khyad par rnam pa bcu gnyis med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / de lta na go byang chub sems dpa' rnams las nyan thos rnams kyi khyad par rnam pa bcu gnyis med par 'gyur te /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúIn that case, there would be no twelvefold difference between the Bodhisattvas and the Sravakas.‚Äù

original: grol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par dang / rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas sdud pa'i ye shes mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par dang / rnam par grol ba'i spyi'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: grol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par dang / rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas sdud pa'i ye shes mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par dang / rnam par grol ba'i spyi'i khyad par dang /
translated: the specific general characteristics of liberation,üîΩthe specific destruction of demons and opponents,üîΩthe specific nonlearner,üîΩthe specific worthiness of worship because of being worthy of worship,

original: bdud dang phyir rgol ba bcom pa'i khyad par dang / mi slob pa'i khyad par dang / mchod par 'os pa'i phyir mchod par 'os pa'i khyad par dang / skyes bu zung bzhi dang / gang zag brgyad kyi dbang du byas nas dge 'dun gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: bdud dang phyir rgol ba bcom pa'i khyad par dang / mi slob pa'i khyad par dang / mchod par 'os pa'i phyir mchod par 'os pa'i khyad par dang / skyes bu zung bzhi dang / gang zag brgyad kyi dbang du byas nas dge 'dun gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: the specific designation as the supreme Sangha in terms of the four pairs of individuals and the eight kinds of person,

original: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa thob ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa thob ste /
translated: and the attainment of nirvana in this life.

original: chos smra bar gyur pas chos smra ba'i mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par dang / sems can ji snyed pa dang / sems can gyi gnas dgu po ji snyed las sems can gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par dang / mchog tu bsil ba'i dngos po thob pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: chos smra bar gyur pas chos smra ba'i mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par dang / sems can ji snyed pa dang / sems can gyi gnas dgu po ji snyed las sems can gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par dang / mchog tu bsil ba'i dngos po thob pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: the difference in attaining the best of cool things,üîΩthe difference in ruling over sentient beings,

original: sems can la dbang byed pa'i khyad par dang / sdug bsngal yang mi skye ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: sems can la dbang byed pa'i khyad par dang / sdug bsngal yang mi skye ba'i khyad par te /
translated: and the difference in not being born in suffering.

original: klan ka dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe rig par bya'o //
analyzed: klan ka dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe rig par bya'o //
translated: The similes should be understood in order to completely abandon objections.

original: de la grol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po dang / thigs pa chung ngu'i dpe gnyis te /
analyzed: de la grol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po dang / thigs pa chung ngu'i dpe gnyis te /
translated: Among them, the two similes of the great ocean and a small drop are for completely abandoning the difference in the roots of virtue of the liberated one.

original: skye bo mang po nye bar 'tsho ba dang nye bar 'tsho ba ma yin pa'i mthun pa'i chos kyis so //
analyzed: skye bo mang po nye bar 'tsho ba dang nye bar 'tsho ba ma yin pa'i mthun pa'i chos kyis so //
translated: By the concordant Dharma of being a support for many beings and not being a support.

original: ye shes mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir gnyis te /
analyzed: ye shes mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattvas mastery is to be known as tenfold mastery over life, mind, necessities, action, rebirth, will, aspiration, the arts, wisdom, and teaching.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes ni bdag dang gzhan sems can mtha' yas pa'i rgyu rnams sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par grol ba'i spyi bo khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes ni bdag dang gzhan sems can mtha' yas pa'i rgyu rnams sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro // rnam par grol ba'i spyi bo khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattvas mastery over life is shown by the fact that he can prolong or shorten the duration of his life as he wishes.

original: de la btsun mo dam pa lta bu ni rnam par grol bar rig par bya'o //üîΩskyes bu dbul po lta bu ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i smon lam mo //üîΩbran mo lta bu @236a * //
analyzed: de la btsun mo dam pa lta bu ni rnam par grol bar rig par bya'o // skyes bu dbul po lta bu ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i smon lam mo // bran mo lta bu @236a * //
translated: His mastery over mind is shown by the fact that he can enter and emerge from meditative concentration whenever he wishes.

original: ni sems can la lta ba'o //
analyzed: ni sems can la lta ba'o //
translated: His mastery over necessities is shown by the fact that he can transform anything into anything else.

original: rgyal po lta bu ni theg pa chen po'i smon lam mo //
analyzed: rgyal po lta bu ni theg pa chen po'i smon lam mo //
translated: His mastery over action is shown by the fact that he can perform any action he wishes.üîΩHis mastery over rebirth is shown by the fact that he can be reborn in any state of existence he wishes.üîΩHis mastery over will is shown by the fact that he can make things disappear at will.

original: bdud dang phyir rgol ba bcom pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba'i mtshan dang ldan pa stong gi dpe ste /
analyzed: bdud dang phyir rgol ba bcom pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba'i mtshan dang ldan pa stong gi dpe ste /
translated: His mastery over aspiration is shown by the fact that he can cause things to appear at will.üîΩHis mastery over the arts is shown by the fact that he can manifest all the arts of knowledge and action.üîΩHis mastery over wisdom is shown by the fact that he can manifest the wisdom of omniscience.üîΩHis mastery over teaching is shown by the fact that he can manifest the teaching of the Dharma in all its modes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras su zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras su zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not accepted as the son of the Tathagata.

original: mi slob pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir btsun mo dam pa de'i mngal du gzhon nu 'khor los sgyur ba'i mtshan dang ldan pa zhugs pa 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpe gnyis pa ste /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi gdung 'tsho ba par rab tu gnas pa'i phyir mchod par 'os pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir btsun mo dam pa de'i mngal du gzhon nu 'khor los sgyur ba'i mtshan dang ldan pa zhugs pa 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpe gnyis pa ste / sangs rgyas kyi gdung 'tsho ba par rab tu gnas pa'i phyir mchod par 'os pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: The second example of a universal monarch is the entry into the womb of the supreme queen of the Bodhisattva who is endowed with the marks of a universal monarch, in order to abandon the distinction of being a non-learner.

original: btsun mo dam pa de las gzhon nu mtshan dang ldan pa btsas pa 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpe gsum pa ste /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsun mo dam pa de las gzhon nu mtshan dang ldan pa btsas pa 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpe gsum pa ste / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third example of a universal monarch is the birth of the Bodhisattva endowed with the marks from the supreme queen, in order to abandon the distinction of being worthy of offerings, because he is established as the perpetuator of the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: dge 'dun gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir nor bu rin po che beed'urya'i dpe ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir nor bu rin po che beed'urya'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of the precious jewel vaidurya is in order to abandon the distinction of being designated as the supreme of the Sangha,üîΩbecause it is the cause of omniscience.

original: sa dang pos bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi sems rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang pos bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi sems rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the enlightenment mind included in the first stage.

original: chos smra ba'i mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir sman gyi dpe ste /
analyzed: chos smra ba'i mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir sman gyi dpe ste /
translated: The example of the medicine is for the purpose of avoiding the distinction of being designated as the best of preachers of the Dharma,

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cures the disease of the mental addictions of all sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor btang ste /üîΩsu yang zhes bya ba'i dpe ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi mchog tu btags pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor btang ste / su yang zhes bya ba'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of the moon‚Äôs orb is for the purpose of avoiding the distinction of being designated as the best of sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad la ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmchog tu bsil ba'i dngos po khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir ro // mchog tu bsil ba'i dngos po khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: because he is the moon of sentient beings.

original: zla ba tshes pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zla ba tshes pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of the moon‚Äôs crescent is for the purpose of avoiding the distinction of being the best of those who have attained the highest coolness,üîΩbecause he is the moon of the highest coolness.üîΩThe example of the full moon is for the purpose of avoiding the distinction of being the best of those who have attained the full measure of the two stores,

original: sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rnams yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rnams yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the full moon of the two stores of merit and knowledge that lead to buddhahood.

original: sems can la dbang byed pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can la dbang byed pa'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: The example of the king is for the purpose of avoiding the distinction of being the best of those who rule sentient beings,üîΩbecause he is the king of Dharma.

original: mching bu'i nor byas pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mching bu'i nor byas pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of the jewel made of glass.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva obtains the result of omniscience.

original: sdug bsngal yang mi skye ba'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir nor bu rin po che beed'urya byi dor byas pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang mi skye ba'i khyad par yongs su spang ba'i phyir nor bu rin po che beed'urya byi dor byas pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of the polished precious gem beryl.

original: nyan thos kyi yon tan sems la dbang byed pa'i khyad par thob pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yon tan sems la dbang byed pa'i khyad par thob pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva is the basis of the special attainment of the qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, such as mastery over the mind, and so on.

original: de ltar mdor bsdus te dpe de rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos rnams las khyad par du ston to //
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus te dpe de rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos rnams las khyad par du ston to //
translated: Thus, in brief, those examples show the superiority of the bodhisattvas over the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: 'di man chad ni rgya cher bstan par bya'o //üîΩnyan thos ni du /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni rgya cher bstan par bya'o // nyan thos ni du /
translated: From here on, it should be taught extensively.üîΩHow many kinds of ≈õrƒÅvakas are there?

original: nyan thos kyi @236b bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi @236b bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the training of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and the training of the bodhisattvas?

original: nyan thos ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: nyan thos ni bzhi'o //
translated: There are four kinds of ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: nyan thos kyi bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa bcu gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa bcu gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The difference between the training of the Disciples and the training of the Bodhisattvas should be understood in thirteen ways.

original: sprul pa'i nyan thos dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi nyan thos dang / byang chub tu 'gyur ba dang ; zhi ba gcig tu bgrod pa'o //üîΩde la sprul pa'i nyan thos ni sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'am /
analyzed: sprul pa'i nyan thos dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi nyan thos dang / byang chub tu 'gyur ba dang ; zhi ba gcig tu bgrod pa'o // de la sprul pa'i nyan thos ni sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'am /
translated: The Disciples are of three kinds: the Disciples who are emanations, the Disciples who are of overweening pride, and the Disciples who are destined for the Awakening of a Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sprul pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sprul pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Disciples who are emanations are those who are emanated by the Bodhisattvas or by the Tathagatas in order to train sentient beings.

original: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi nyan thos ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes tsam dang / chos la bdag med pa la log par mngon par zhen pa'i ye shes kyis yang dag par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi nyan thos ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes tsam dang / chos la bdag med pa la log par mngon par zhen pa'i ye shes kyis yang dag par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Disciples who are of overweening pride are those who are attached to the knowledge of the selflessness of persons, and who are attached to the knowledge that is wrongly attached to the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de la byang chub tu 'gyur ba ni thog ma med pa nas snying rje'i rigs shin tu chung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub tu 'gyur ba ni thog ma med pa nas snying rje'i rigs shin tu chung ba yin te /
translated: The Disciples who are destined for the Awakening of a Buddha are those who, from beginningless [time], have a very small lineage of compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang nye bar gnas pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po rnams la yon tan du 'du shes pas yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyun du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang nye bar gnas pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po rnams la yon tan du 'du shes pas yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyun du 'gyur te /
translated: Because they are close to the Tathagata, they are continuously imbued with the perception of the qualities of the extensive Buddha-Dharmas.

original: de'i mthar phyin nas zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa la sangs rgyas rnams yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: de'i mthar phyin nas zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa la sangs rgyas rnams yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: When they have perfected that, the Buddhas exhort them to abide in the uncontaminated realm.

original: 'dzud do // thabs nye bar ston to //
analyzed: 'dzud do // thabs nye bar ston to //
translated: They introduce them to it and show them the means.

original: de rgyu des na /
analyzed: de rgyu des na /
translated: By that cause,

original: byang chub chen po mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen po mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: they accomplish the great enlightenment.

original: de de ltar byang chub chen po mngon par sgrub kyang /
analyzed: de de ltar byang chub chen po mngon par sgrub kyang /
translated: Although they accomplish the great enlightenment in that way,

original: zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir /
translated: because they delight in peace,

original: de sbyor ba de la 'jug pa shin tu zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: de sbyor ba de la 'jug pa shin tu zhen pa yin te /
translated: they are very attached to that practice.

original: de lta bu ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs ma yin te /
translated: That is not the Buddha lineage of the first production of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de la zhi ba gcig tu bgrod pa ni thog ma nyid nas snying rje'i rigs shin tu chung ba dang / sems can don la rab tu rgyab kyis bltas pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'i bsam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la zhi ba gcig tu bgrod pa ni thog ma nyid nas snying rje'i rigs shin tu chung ba dang / sems can don la rab tu rgyab kyis bltas pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'i bsam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The one who proceeds to peace alone is one who from the very beginning has a very weak lineage of compassion, who is utterly indifferent to the welfare of sentient beings, and who is intent on abiding in nirvana because of fear of suffering.

original: byang chub chen po mngon par sgrub pa'i skal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po mngon par sgrub pa'i skal ba med pa'o //
translated: He is not a fit vessel for the realization of great enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste dper na rgyal po'i bu skye ba'i gnas 'dra ba las skyes pa gnyis shig 'dra bar rgyal po'i bde ba la yongs su spyod de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na rgyal po'i bu skye ba'i gnas 'dra ba las skyes pa gnyis shig 'dra bar rgyal po'i bde ba la yongs su spyod de /
translated: For example, two princes are born in similar circumstances and enjoy the pleasures of the king equally.

original: de la gcig ni rgyal po'i gtsug lag dang / rang bzo dang / bzo ba'i gnas la mkhas la /
analyzed: de la gcig ni rgyal po'i gtsug lag dang / rang bzo dang / bzo ba'i gnas la mkhas la /
translated: One of them is skilled in the king's arts, crafts, and techniques,

original: cig shos ni de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: cig shos ni de lta ma yin na /
translated: while the other is not.

original: de gnyis yan lag des khyad par du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de gnyis yan lag des khyad par du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: They are distinguished by that difference in abilities,

original: rgyal po'i bde ba'i longs spyod kyis ni ma yin no //
