original: de dag gi las ji ltar mi 'khrung bar 'gyur ba de dag gi don byed pa la rab tu brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bskrun pa'i phyir de dag las 'khrung bar bstan pa'i don du mdo sde mtshams sbyar ba brtson te /
analyzed: de dag gi las ji ltar mi 'khrung bar 'gyur ba de dag gi don byed pa la rab tu brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bskrun pa'i phyir de dag las 'khrung bar bstan pa'i don du mdo sde mtshams sbyar ba brtson te /
translated: The sutra is connected to that point.

original: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la brtson par bya'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la brtson par bya'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äú KƒÅ≈õyapa, bodhisattvas should strive to benefit sentient beings.‚Äù

original: phyogs bzhir song nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sems can gyi don mdzad par sbyor ba ston to //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir song nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sems can gyi don mdzad par sbyor ba ston to //
translated: The phrase having gone to the four directions indicates that all bodhisattvas in all world-realms are engaged in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: yang dag par gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag par gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should make a request means

original: gang sman pas lus gso ba byas pa dang / gang mu stegs can gyis nyon mongs pa gso ba byas pa de ni brda tsam dang phyin ci log tu gyur pas yang dag pa'i gso ba ma yin no //üîΩde la sman pa lta bu ni /
analyzed: gang sman pas lus gso ba byas pa dang / gang mu stegs can gyis nyon mongs pa gso ba byas pa de ni brda tsam dang phyin ci log tu gyur pas yang dag pa'i gso ba ma yin no // de la sman pa lta bu ni /
translated: that the healing of the body by a physician and the healing of the afflictions by a tƒ´rthika are not true healing, because they are merely conventional and erroneous.

original: byang chub sems dpar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar rig par bya'o //
translated: The physician there is like a bodhisattva.

original: nad pa lta bu ni sems can rnams so //
analyzed: nad pa lta bu ni sems can rnams so //
translated: The sick person is like sentient beings.

original: nad lta bu ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nad lta bu ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The disease is like attachment and so on.

original: sman lta bu ni mi sdug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sman lta bu ni mi sdug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The medicine is like the repulsive and so on.

original: ji ltar rgyu gsum gyis khams mi mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid du lus kyi nang du 'gyur te /üîΩla la ni nyes pa brtsams pas /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu gsum gyis khams mi mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid du lus kyi nang du 'gyur te / la la ni nyes pa brtsams pas /
translated: In the same way, there are three reasons why the body is characterized by an imbalance of elements:üîΩsome are due to the commission of faults,

original: la la ni mi 'phrod pa bsten pas /
analyzed: la la ni mi 'phrod pa bsten pas /
translated: some are due to the use of unwholesome things,üîΩand some are due to the combination of the two.

original: la la ni yal bar 'dor bas so //
analyzed: la la ni yal bar 'dor bas so //
translated: Some are abandoned by indifference.

original: de bzhin du rgyu gsum gyis sems mi mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid sems kyi nang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu gsum gyis sems mi mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid sems kyi nang du 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, three causes give rise to the characteristics of an unbalanced mind.

original: la la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa brtsams pas te /
analyzed: la la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa brtsams pas te /
translated: Some are due to the arising of the afflictions such as passion.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yun ring po nas goms par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yun ring po nas goms par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has long been accustomed to passion, etc.

original: la la ni lta ba la sogs pa mi 'phrod pa bsten pa ste /
analyzed: la la ni lta ba la sogs pa mi 'phrod pa bsten pa ste /
translated: Some are due to the arising of views, etc.

original: lta ba la sogs pa phal cher de ltar byung ba'i sbyor bas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa phal cher de ltar byung ba'i sbyor bas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because views, etc. are generated by the practice of most of them.

original: la la ni phyin ci log tu kun du 'byung ba yal bar 'dor bas so //
analyzed: la la ni phyin ci log tu kun du 'byung ba yal bar 'dor bas so //
translated: Some are due to the abandonment of the arising of errors.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i nad dang po'i gnyen po ni mi sdug @239a * //üîΩphal sogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i nad dang po'i gnyen po ni mi sdug @239a * // phal sogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The antidotes to the first three of these afflictive diseases are, respectively,

original: 'dod chags la gnyen po mi sdug pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags la gnyen po mi sdug pa /
translated: disgust, love, and dependent origination.üîΩIt should be understood that disgust is the antidote to passion,

original: zhes sdang la byams pa /
analyzed: zhes sdang la byams pa /
translated: love is the antidote to hostility,

original: gti mug la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and dependent origination is the antidote to delusion.

original: gnyis pa'i gnyen por ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i gnyen por ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the second is emptiness and so on.

original: de lta ba la mngon par zhen pa dang ; snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba dang / skye ba 'dod pa dang / thar pa ma yin pa la thar par 'du shes pa sems can rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ba la mngon par zhen pa dang ; snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba dang / skye ba 'dod pa dang / thar pa ma yin pa la thar par 'du shes pa sems can rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The four types of sentient beings are those who are attached to views, those who experience the taste of meditative attainment, those who desire birth and those who perceive nonliberation as liberation.

original: de la lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang du byas nas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang du byas nas stong pa nyid de /
translated: Emptiness is for the sake of those who are attached to views,

original: lta bar song ba thams cad la stong pa nyid kyis gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lta bar song ba thams cad la stong pa nyid kyis gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúAll views are cured by emptiness.‚Äù

original: / snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: / snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Signlessness is for the sake of those who experience the taste of meditative attainment,

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa yid la byed pa thams cad la mtshan ma med pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa yid la byed pa thams cad la mtshan ma med pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúAll mental contemplations of investigation, discursive thought and objective observation are signless.‚Äù

original: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba bstan to ;
analyzed: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba bstan to ;
translated: It is taught that all investigation and discursive thought experience the taste of meditative attainment.

original: / skye bar 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / skye bar 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of expectancy is taught from the point of view of the desire for rebirth.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / spang ba'i phyir smon pa med pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / spang ba'i phyir smon pa med pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of expectancy is taught in order to abandon the desire realm and the form realm, as it is said: because of the absence of expectancy.

original: thar pa ma yin pa la thar bar 'du shes pa'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci log pa bstan to //
analyzed: thar pa ma yin pa la thar bar 'du shes pa'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci log pa bstan to //
translated: The error is taught from the point of view of the desire for liberation in what is not liberation.

original: phyin ci log thams cad spang ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa bzhi zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: phyin ci log thams cad spang ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa bzhi zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te //
translated: The four kinds of non-error are taught in order to abandon all error, as it is said: because of the four kinds of non-error.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa mthong bas thar ba ma yin pa la thar pa'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa mthong bas thar ba ma yin pa la thar pa'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
translated: Liberation is not seen as permanent, etc. , but the notion of liberation arises from the view of permanence, etc.

original: phyin ci log kun du 'byung ba yal bar 'dor ba'i phyir tha ma'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi po 'dus pa dang / ma 'dus pa rnams kyi gnyen por rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log kun du 'byung ba yal bar 'dor ba'i phyir tha ma'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi po 'dus pa dang / ma 'dus pa rnams kyi gnyen por rig bar bya'o //
translated: The four kinds of error are taught from the point of view of the last, in order to remedy the error of those who are not yet free from error and those who are free from error, as it is said: because of the four kinds of error.

original: tha ma ni so so'i skye bo rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: tha ma ni so so'i skye bo rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The last refers to the six kinds of ordinary beings.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are the antidote to the afflicted view of the self.

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa de'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa de'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams so //
translated: The right efforts are the antidote to the mixture of afflictions.

original: phan tshun du nga rgyal gyis mngon par zin pa de'i gnyen por rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: phan tshun du nga rgyal gyis mngon par zin pa de'i gnyen por rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
translated: The bases of supernatural power are the antidote to the pride of mutual grasping.

original: dge ba'i phyogs dang mi ldan pa de'i gnyen por dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs dang mi ldan pa de'i gnyen por dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams so //
translated: The faculties and powers are the antidote to the lack of virtuous qualities.

original: bden pa la kun du rmongs pa'i gnyen por byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: bden pa la kun du rmongs pa'i gnyen por byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: The branches of enlightenment are the antidote to confusion about the truths.

original: ngo mtshar dang / bkra shis la sogs par lta ba de'i gnyen por lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: ngo mtshar dang / bkra shis la sogs par lta ba de'i gnyen por lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: The path factors are the antidote to the view of miracles, auspiciousness, and so on.

original: ji ltar lus kyi rjes su lta @239b yang bdag tu lta bar mi ltung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi rjes su lta @239b yang bdag tu lta bar mi ltung zhe na /
translated: How does one observe the body without falling into the view of self?

original: gang bdag gis mthong ngo snyam du rlom sems med pa'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gis mthong ngo snyam du rlom sems med pa'o //
translated: It is when one is without the conceit ‚ÄúI see.‚Äù

original: ma dad pa la sogs pas dge ba'i chos rnams mi phyogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pas dge ba'i chos rnams mi phyogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that lack of faith and so on are unfavorable to virtuous qualities.

original: de'i gnyen por dbang po dang / stobs rnams so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por dbang po dang / stobs rnams so //
translated: The faculties and powers are their antidotes.

original: 'od srungs 'dzam bu'i gling na sman pa dang sman pa'i slob ma ji snyed pa de dag gi nang na 'tsho byed ni mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'dzam bu'i gling na sman pa dang sman pa'i slob ma ji snyed pa de dag gi nang na 'tsho byed ni mchog ces bya'o //
translated: KaSyapa, among all the physicians and physician's apprentices in Jambudvipa, Jivaka is called the best.üîΩ If all the sentient beings in the great billion world universe were like Jivaka the physician, they would all together not be able to tend to the wounds of a single person who has entered the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten na sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed dang 'dra bar gyur ces bya ba ni 'tsho byed dang de 'dra ba'i sems can rnams kyis gtsug lag la mkhas pa'i sgo mang po dangüîΩ/ spobs pa kun tu ston to //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten na sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed dang 'dra bar gyur ces bya ba ni 'tsho byed dang de 'dra ba'i sems can rnams kyis gtsug lag la mkhas pa'i sgo mang po dang / spobs pa kun tu ston to //
translated: The wounds of the Bodhisattvas are the many doors of learning in the scriptures, and the many kinds of eloquence that are displayed.

original: lta ba dang 'gyod pa smos pa ni lta ba dang 'gyod pa gso dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba dang 'gyod pa smos pa ni lta ba dang 'gyod pa gso dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of views and remorse is because views and remorse are difficult to cure.

original: de la lta ba ni rnam par grol ba 'dod pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa la bar chad byed de /
analyzed: de la lta ba ni rnam par grol ba 'dod pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa la bar chad byed de /
translated: Among them, views obstruct the mind that is in equipoise and desires liberation.

original: dper na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can gyi gnas brtan pa dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: dper na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can gyi gnas brtan pa dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: For example, the elders who were the venerable Sammitiyas thought,

original: 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag pa'i bar du mod kyi 'on kyang 'o na go bdag gi bdag ga la yod snyam nas khong dogs pa'i phyir bdag 'du byed thams cad zhi ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag pa'i bar du mod kyi 'on kyang 'o na go bdag gi bdag ga la yod snyam nas khong dogs pa'i phyir bdag 'du byed thams cad zhi ba /
translated: Thus, though one understands that form is impermanent and so on, one still doubts, thinking, Where is the self?üîΩOne does not turn the mind to the self's peace,

original: stong pa nyid /
analyzed: stong pa nyid /
translated: emptiness,

original: mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa /
translated: nonapprehending,

original: sred bzad pa /
analyzed: sred bzad pa /
translated: the exhaustion of craving,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: freedom from attachment,

original: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems 'jug par mi 'gyur rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems 'jug par mi 'gyur rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: cessation, or nirvana,üîΩand thinks, My mind turns away.

original: bdag gi yid ldog go snyam du sems so zhes smra ba de ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi yid ldog go snyam du sems so zhes smra ba de ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught in the following:

original: de'i tshe de shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa yid la byed pa na 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pas bdag med par 'gyur ro snyam nas yid mi bde ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa las yid ldog ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa yid la byed pa na 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pas bdag med par 'gyur ro snyam nas yid mi bde ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa las yid ldog ste /
translated: At that time, when one turns the mind to the thought of nirvana through wisdom, one turns away from nirvana, thinking, I will become selfless, because one is unhappy due to not having abandoned the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'o na go bdag gis bdag la ga la yod ces bya bas so /
analyzed: 'o na go bdag gis bdag la ga la yod ces bya bas so /
translated: One thinks, Where is the self that I have?

original: de ni 'du byed tsam du zad na 'di la su zhig med par 'gyur snyam du de ltar mi sems te /
analyzed: de ni 'du byed tsam du zad na 'di la su zhig med par 'gyur snyam du de ltar mi sems te /
translated: If it is only a formation, who is there who would be nonexistent?

original: de dus de na 'jig rten gyi lam gyis gsor mi rung ba'i phyir gsor mi rung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dus de na 'jig rten gyi lam gyis gsor mi rung ba'i phyir gsor mi rung zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, it is said to be incurable because it cannot be cured by the worldly path.

original: 'gyod pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'gyod pa ni khams mnyam par 'dod pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa la bar chad byed do //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'gyod pa ni khams mnyam par 'dod pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa la bar chad byed do //
translated: Regret is a cause of confusion, so regret is an obstacle to the mind that is equipoised and desires the equality of the elements.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'gyod pa sel bar shin tu spyod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'gyod pa sel bar shin tu spyod de /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the Bodhisattvas are very active in removing regret.

original: de bas na lta ba dang / 'gyod pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba dang / 'gyod pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, view and regret are mentioned.

original: shes par mi nus zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //üîΩbstan pa 'am /
analyzed: shes par mi nus zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so // bstan pa 'am /
translated: It cannot be known means by the mental faculty.

original: bsgo pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: bsgo pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
translated: It is taught or it is explained by the word.

original: @240a * // bstan pa dang bshad pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: @240a * // bstan pa dang bshad pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: By both teaching and explanation.

original: tshogs kyi lam shin tu yongs su brtsal nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis yongs su tshol bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam btsal bar bya'o //üîΩrtog pa de yang gang zag la bdag med pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam shin tu yongs su brtsal nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis yongs su tshol bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam btsal bar bya'o // rtog pa de yang gang zag la bdag med pa las brtsams te /
translated: Having thoroughly investigated the path of accumulation, one should seek the supramundane path with a mind that is conceptual.

original: rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that conceptualization should be understood as twofold, beginning with the selflessness of the person.

original: chos la bdag med pa las brtsams na rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa las brtsams na rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: If one begins with the selflessness of phenomena, it is of one kind.

original: rkyen la 'jug pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen la 'jug pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the wisdom that engages conditions, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag med pa'i chos rnams la mos pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag med pa'i chos rnams la mos pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the wisdom of conviction in the phenomena of selflessness.

original: de la thos par mos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ye shes ni mos pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la thos par mos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ye shes ni mos pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Among them, the wisdom that precedes conviction in hearing is the wisdom of conviction.

original: sems dus rnam par chad pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / bdag med par yongs su tshol ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs par ston te /
analyzed: sems dus rnam par chad pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / bdag med par yongs su tshol ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs par ston te /
translated: The investigation of the mind as discontinuous, inactive, and selfless teaches the realization of dependent origination and the selflessness of the person.

original: nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams dang / de la gnas shing dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin du sems mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams dang / de la gnas shing dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin du sems mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the internal and external sense-spheres and the consciousnesses which are based on them and perceive them are not perceived as having an imagined nature.

original: dpyad du med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs par ston to //
analyzed: dpyad du med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs par ston to //
translated: The fact that the reality of the perfected nature, which is characterized by being non-analyzable, etc., is not perceived, demonstrates the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin de sems nyid du yod do zhes med pa la 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang dus gsum du ma gzigs zhes bya ba gsungs kyi /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin de sems nyid du yod do zhes med pa la 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang dus gsum du ma gzigs zhes bya ba gsungs kyi /
translated: In order to abandon the grasping of the existence of that perfected nature as the mind itself, it is said that it is not seen by all the Buddhas in the three times.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i gzigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i gzigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not seen by spontaneous vision.

original: chos nyid kyis de ltar gnas par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dus gsum du yang ma gzigs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis de ltar gnas par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dus gsum du yang ma gzigs zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it abides in reality in that way, it is said that it is not seen by all the Buddhas in the three times.

original: de ltar kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin med kyang kun du brtags pa'i de'i rgyu gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin yod par yongs su brtags pa'i phyir sems kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin med kyang kun du brtags pa'i de'i rgyu gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin yod par yongs su brtags pa'i phyir sems kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, with regard to the mind, it is said:

original: log par ltung ba'i 'du shes las chos rnams 'byung ba ma gtogs par gang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ba de'i rgyu ci 'dra zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: log par ltung ba'i 'du shes las chos rnams 'byung ba ma gtogs par gang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ba de'i rgyu ci 'dra zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: What is the cause of those phenomena that arise from the discriminations of false falling, except that all the Buddhas have not seen, do not see, and will not see?

original: chos rnams ni 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya bar bzhed do //
analyzed: chos rnams ni 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya bar bzhed do //
translated: Here, phenomena are accepted as the mind and mental factors.

original: gal te log par ltung ba'i 'du shes tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gal te log par ltung ba'i 'du shes tsam du zad de /
translated: If it is just the discrimination of false falling,

original: ji ltar 'khor ba na 'chi 'pho dang / skye bar 'gyur snyam pa la sgyu ma dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba na 'chi 'pho dang / skye bar 'gyur snyam pa la sgyu ma dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
translated: how is it established as being like an illusion in the thought that one will die and be reborn in cyclic existence?

original: sems gcig po kho na zhig 'khor ro snyam pa la @240b 'bab chu'i rgyun dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
analyzed: sems gcig po kho na zhig 'khor ro snyam pa la @240b 'bab chu'i rgyun dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
translated: How is it established as being like the flow of a river in the thought that only the mind alone cycles?

original: de ltar sems la 'dod chags dang bral na ci'i phyir thar bar mi 'gyur snyam pa la rlung dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
analyzed: de ltar sems la 'dod chags dang bral na ci'i phyir thar bar mi 'gyur snyam pa la rlung dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
translated: It is well established as being like the wind.

original: de la ring du 'gro ba ni don gyi rnam pa thams cad de'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ring du 'gro ba ni don gyi rnam pa thams cad de'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the far-reaching is to be known as the nature of all aspects of objects.

original: de ltar yongs su shes par dka' na ji ltar thar bar 'gyur snyam pa la mar me'i 'od 'phro ba dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub ste /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su shes par dka' na ji ltar thar bar 'gyur snyam pa la mar me'i 'od 'phro ba dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub ste /
translated: If it is difficult to fully understand in that way, how will there be liberation? It is well established as being like the light of a lamp,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis 'byung la de zad na mi 'byung bar yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis 'byung la de zad na mi 'byung bar yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to demonstrate that it arises through the power of the condition of ignorance, and that when it ceases, it does not arise.

original: gal te sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur na nyon mongs pa bzhin du de rnam par dag par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur na nyon mongs pa bzhin du de rnam par dag par mi rung ste /
translated: If the mind becomes afflicted due to the power of afflictions, it would not be suitable for purification, just like the afflictions.

original: thar bar mi 'thad do snyam pa'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs par ston to //
analyzed: thar bar mi 'thad do snyam pa'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs par ston to //
translated: The fault of the untenability of liberation is eliminated by teaching it to be like space.

original: nam mkha' ltar mi 'gyur ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir glog dang mtshungs par ston te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar mi 'gyur ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir glog dang mtshungs par ston te /
translated: In order to avoid the fault of non-change like space, he is shown to be like lightning.

original: skad cig par 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir mi rtag cing 'gyur bar yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig par 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir mi rtag cing 'gyur bar yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is impermanent and changeable, he is shown to be momentary, and because he does not dwell in attachment, etc., he is shown to be changeable.

original: sems rnam par dag kyang skad cig tu 'jig pas nyes pa spang ba'i phyir spre'u dang mtshungs par ston te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag kyang skad cig tu 'jig pas nyes pa spang ba'i phyir spre'u dang mtshungs par ston te /
translated: In order to avoid the fault of momentary destruction, even though the mind is pure, he is shown to be like a monkey.

original: de la yul rnam pa sna tshogs 'dod pas rnam par g-yeng ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yul rnam pa sna tshogs 'dod pas rnam par g-yeng ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therein, he is not distracted by the desire for various objects.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pas mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pas mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, because he is endowed with attachment, etc., he does not dwell.

original: rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur na ci'i phyir thams cad mthun par mngon par mi 'gyur bar mi 'gyur snyam pa la ri mo mkhan dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur na ci'i phyir thams cad mthun par mngon par mi 'gyur bar mi 'gyur snyam pa la ri mo mkhan dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
translated: In order to avoid the fault of distraction, he is shown to be like a painter, since he is not distracted by the desire for various objects.

original: ci'i phyir dus thams cad du rang bzhin gcig pa'i lam mngon par 'du mi byed snyam pa la mi gnas par rab tu sgrub ste /üîΩkhams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dus thams cad du rang bzhin gcig pa'i lam mngon par 'du mi byed snyam pa la mi gnas par rab tu sgrub ste / khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why does it not always have the same nature? It is established that it is not permanent because it arises through the power of the afflictions of the three realms.

original: ci'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyi dbang gis cig car du mi skye snyam pa la gcig pu rgyu bar rab tu sgrub po //üîΩci'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i las zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyi dbang gis cig car du mi skye snyam pa la gcig pu rgyu bar rab tu sgrub po // ci'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i las zil gyis mnan te /
translated: Why does it not arise simultaneously through the power of all the formations? It is established that it moves alone because it arises through the power of the formations of the past.

original: res 'ga' sngon mngon par 'du byas pa'i dbang gis skye snyam pa la rgyal po dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' sngon mngon par 'du byas pa'i dbang gis skye snyam pa la rgyal po dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub ste /
translated: Why does it sometimes arise through the power of past formations? It is established that it is like a king because it is taught that it is the power of karma that is the king.

original: las gang gis stobs dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa de sems la bsgoms pas dbang thob pa yin no zhes yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las gang gis stobs dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa de sems la bsgoms pas dbang thob pa yin no zhes yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught that it is the power of karma that is the king because it is taught that it is the power of karma that is the king.

original: gal te rgyal po dang 'dra na ci'i phyir bdag la sdug bsngal skyed snyam pa la mi mdza' pa dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
analyzed: gal te rgyal po dang 'dra na ci'i phyir bdag la sdug bsngal skyed snyam pa la mi mdza' pa dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub po //
translated: In response to this, he establishes it as being like an enemy.

original: ci'i phyir @241a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir @241a * //
translated: Why is it like an enemy?

original: bdag la mi 'dza' ba dang mtshungs par byed snyam pa la bye ma'i khyim dang / nya'i mchil pa dang / rmi lam dang / sbrang ma sngon po dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub ste /
analyzed: bdag la mi 'dza' ba dang mtshungs par byed snyam pa la bye ma'i khyim dang / nya'i mchil pa dang / rmi lam dang / sbrang ma sngon po dang mtshungs par rab tu sgrub ste /
translated: In response to this, he establishes it as being like a house of sand, a fish-hook, a dream, and a blue-fly.

original: lus la sogs pa la phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa la sogs pa yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa la sogs pa yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with the four errors in regard to the body, etc.

original: de ltar na go ci'i phyir bde bar skye ba rnams skye ba bsgrub snyam pa'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir rgol ba dang mtshungs par ston te /
analyzed: de ltar na go ci'i phyir bde bar skye ba rnams skye ba bsgrub snyam pa'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir rgol ba dang mtshungs par ston te /
translated: Thus, in order to eliminate the fault of the question, ‚ÄúWhy does the body, etc., which is produced as pleasure, produce suffering?‚Äù he shows that it is like a disputant.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyis der yang sdug bsngal 'grub par yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyis der yang sdug bsngal 'grub par yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he shows that suffering is established there by the three kinds of suffering.

original: de de ltar sdug bsngal na ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por lam mi bsten snyam la gnod sbyin mdangs 'phrog pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i rgyur ston te /üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang / yongs su nyams par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de de ltar sdug bsngal na ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por lam mi bsten snyam la gnod sbyin mdangs 'phrog pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i rgyur ston te / snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang / yongs su nyams par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: If he is suffering in that way, why does he not rely on the path as an antidote to suffering?

original: go rims bzhin no //üîΩci'i phyir gnyen po la mi dga' snyam pa la rkun po dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu ston te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin no // ci'i phyir gnyen po la mi dga' snyam pa la rkun po dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu ston te /
translated: The cause is shown to be like a demon that steals one's vital force, because he is addicted to the taste of meditative concentration and because he is completely ruined.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs la rku ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs la rku ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is shown to be like a thief, because he steals the accumulation of the roots of virtue.

original: gal te sdug bsngal la yang yon tan du rtogs nas dga' na de ltar gyur ba la nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la yang yon tan du rtogs nas dga' na de ltar gyur ba la nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: If one is pleased because one has understood the virtues of suffering, what is wrong with that?

original: phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgud pa dang ldan pas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas gnod pa ston to //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgud pa dang ldan pas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas gnod pa ston to //
translated: The fault is shown to be that one is harmed by attachment and aversion to prosperity and misfortune respectively.

original: gal te gnod par byed na ci'i phyir dga' snyam pa la gzugs la sogs pa la dga' ba'i phyir phyi byi zho la'i mig dang / g-yul gyi rnga dang / phag dang / bran mo zas kyi lhag ma za ba dang / sbrang ma dang mtshungs par ston te /
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed na ci'i phyir dga' snyam pa la gzugs la sogs pa la dga' ba'i phyir phyi byi zho la'i mig dang / g-yul gyi rnga dang / phag dang / bran mo zas kyi lhag ma za ba dang / sbrang ma dang mtshungs par ston te /
translated: The Buddha teaches that you are like a peacock's eye, a war drum, a pig, a servant who eats leftovers, or a bee.

original: 'od srungs sems ni kun du btsal na mi rnyed do zhes bya ba mtshams ji ltar sbyar zhe na /üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyi rgyu bstan nas ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni kun du btsal na mi rnyed do zhes bya ba mtshams ji ltar sbyar zhe na / gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyi rgyu bstan nas ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin te /
translated: KaSyapa, when you search for mind, you do not find it. How is this passage to be interpreted?üîΩHaving taught the dependent nature, he now teaches the consummate nature.

original: yongs su tshol ba na kun du brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin tshol ba de kun du ston te /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba na kun du brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin tshol ba de kun du ston te /
translated: He shows that when you search for the dependent nature, you find the imagined nature and the consummate nature.

original: kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems de btsal na don du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems de btsal na don du mi dmigs so //
translated: When you search for the mind that is the imagined nature, you do not find it as an object.

original: gang mi dmigs pas rab tu phye ba de ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pas rab tu phye ba de ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
translated: That which is distinguished by not being found is the consummate nature of mind.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas su 'og nas ston par bzhed nas de dus gsum du mi 'byung bar ston te /
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas su 'og nas ston par bzhed nas de dus gsum du mi 'byung bar ston te /
translated: Since it is asserted that this is unconditioned, it is shown that it does not occur in the three times.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa nas de ma thag tu sems med pa'i phyir dus gsum du mi 'byung ba de ltar mi 'byung ba na ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa nas de ma thag tu sems med pa'i phyir dus gsum du mi 'byung ba de ltar mi 'byung ba na ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Just as one who has entered the state of composure that is a cessation does not have mind immediately after that, and so it is not said that he exists in the three times, it should be understood that the ultimate does not exist in the three times in the same way.

original: dus gsum las 'das par kun du ston to //
analyzed: dus gsum las 'das par kun du ston to //
translated: It is shown that it transcends the three times.

original: @241b de ni dus gsum las ma 'das pas langs pa na yang sems 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @241b de ni dus gsum las ma 'das pas langs pa na yang sems 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one who has arisen from that state has mind, it does not transcend the three times.

original: gang dus gsum las 'das pa de med par log par 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir bzlog ste /
analyzed: gang dus gsum las 'das pa de med par log par 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir bzlog ste /
translated: In order to abandon the conception that what transcends the three times does not exist, it is said to be neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: yod pa dang med pa ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ma yin par ston te /
translated: It is shown to be neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: kun brtags dang gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyis ni med la yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni yod par yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags dang gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyis ni med la yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni yod par yongs su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is shown to be nonexistent due to the imagined and dependent natures, and it is shown to be existent due to the perfected nature.

original: de ni ma byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por ro //
analyzed: de ni ma byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por ro //
translated: It is said to be unarisen in the sense of being a cause.

original: de la ngo bo nyid med do zhes byas pas ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i so sor nges pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid med do zhes byas pas ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i so sor nges pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: By saying it has no intrinsic reality, [the Buddha] means that it has no intrinsic reality as the cause for the individual destinies, such as the destiny of the hells.

original: de la skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu med pa'o //üîΩde la 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho ba'o //üîΩde 'bral ba med do zhes bya ba ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu med pa'o // de la 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho ba'o // de 'bral ba med do zhes bya ba ni spong ba'o //
translated: By saying it is unborn, [the Buddha] means that it has no cause for birth.üîΩBy saying it does not cease, [the Buddha] means that it does not transmigrate.üîΩBy saying it is not subject to diminution, [the Buddha] means that it is not subject to abandonment.

original: de 'bral ba med pa la zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba med pa la'o //
analyzed: de 'bral ba med pa la zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba med pa la'o //
translated: By saying it is not subject to abandonment, [the Buddha] means that it is not subject to the abandonment of what is to be abandoned.
